Title: Analista de datos
Description:
🧠 Data Analyst

Ubicación: Madrid (formato híbrido)

Modalidad: Jornada completa | Contrato indefinido




🌟 Sobre el proyecto

En Brainy Commerce ayudamos a empresas a aprovechar todo el potencial de los grandes marketplaces como Amazon, Mercado Libre y Wallmart, Alibaba (Aliexpress, Miravia) y ahora también Tik Tok Shop, impulsando sus ventas locales e internacionales. Tenemos en marcha una herramienta digital que da visibilidad sobre el rendimiento, la publicidad y el mercado, integrando datos de múltiples fuentes en tiempo real.

Como analista de datos, serás parte fundamental en este proceso, ayudando a convertir datos complejos en insights accionables para nuestros equipos y nuestros clientes. Este puesto va mucho más allá de generar dashboards o paneles: buscamos un perfil analítico, curioso y orientado al negocio.







🎯 Tus responsabilidades

Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos relacionados con ventas, pricing, competencia, etc.
Diseñar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI, que aporten valor a negocio y consultoría.
Colaborar estrechamente con los equipos de cuentas, data engineering y marketing para definir necesidades de reporting.
Proponer mejoras continuas en los modelos de análisis de datos.
Contribuir activamente en el diseño del producto desde la perspectiva de los datos.
Validar insights con stakeholders internos y clientes.







🧩 Lo que buscamos

1–2 años de experiencia como analista de datos o posición similar.
Conocimientos avanzados de Power BI (medidas DAX, modelado de datos, dashboards).
Capacidad para estructurar datos de distintas fuentes y generar reportes automáticos y eficientes.
Nivel intermedio en SQL.
Deseable: conocimientos básicos en Python, APIs, o herramientas de automatización de datos.
Deseable: experiencia previa en e-commerce, marketplaces o SaaS.







🧠 Perfil ideal

Te obsesiona entender el por qué detrás de los datos.
Te entusiasma contar historias con gráficos, no solo con números.
Tienes mentalidad de producto: entiendes cómo los datos impactan en decisiones reales.
Te gusta colaborar con otros perfiles (tech, negocio, marketing).
Eres organizado/a y sabes comunicar hallazgos complejos de forma clara.







🚀 Qué te ofrecemos

Participar en un proyecto con gran impacto en una empresa en crecimiento.
Formación continua en negocio, visualización, automatización y modelado de datos.
Oportunidades reales de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento horizontal.
Ambiente joven, colaborativo, muy orientado a la innovación.
Trabajo híbrido desde nuestra oficina en Plaza de España (Madrid).







¿Quieres sumarte a un equipo apasionado por la tecnología, los datos y los retos de negocio?

¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Grupo Digital, buscamos un/a Data Analyst para trabajar con uno de nuestros grandes clientes.

Lugar de trabajo: Madrid. Zona Atocha.

Modalidad: Híbrida. 2 días por semana en oficina. 3 en remto.

Salario: 30 - 36.000 brutos anuales (según experiencia).

Requisitos

Al menos 2 años de experiencia en análisis de datos, implementar algoritmos que procesen automáticamente los datos para mejorar sus predicciones.

Experiencia con herramient BI: Tableau Python, R, Scala, SQL.

Formación: Licenciatrua o Grado Superior.

¿Qué es lo que le ofrecemos?

Salario competitivo en función de la experiencia

Contrato indefinido u Opción de Contrato Mercantil

22 días laborables de vacaciones

Plan de retribución flexible: Seguro médico, cheques guardería, cheques transporte

Formación en Tecnología y Soft Skills

Programa de referidos: 500 por candidatos recomendados que se incorporen con nosotros

Grupo Digital

Somos un equipo de más de 100 profesionales tecnológicos, en el que encontraras proyectos estables, en los principales clientes nacionales e internacionales, desarrollando soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial, Cloud, Ciberseguridad, etc....

Nos comprometemos estar a tu lado en todas las fases del proyecto, para asegurarnos que creces profesionalmente con nosotros, y que tu aportación cuenta.

¿Quieres estar al día con las últimas tecnologías y buscas nuevos desafíos? ¡Envíanos tu CV y nos ponemos en contacto contigo!

Tableau Python, R, Scala, SQL

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💫 ¿Quiénes somos?

El Grupo Digital Virgo es especialista mundial en pagos móviles a través de soluciones de facturación de operadores de telecomunicaciones. Respondiendo así, a la creciente necesidad de pagos digitales utilizando un canal transaccional simple que es rápido, seguro y está disponible en todo el mundo. Cuando te unes a Digital Virgo, te estás integrando a un grupo global innovador con equipos locales que colaboran diariamente gracias a sus habilidades complementarias. Nuestros equipos provienen de entornos multiculturales y diversos; Esta diversidad enriquece nuestra empresa. Nos caracterizamos porque nuestro ambiente de trabajo es la mezcla perfecta entre proyectos ambiciosos y buen humor. Nos enorgullece centrarnos en el desarrollo y la iniciativa individual.

Si quieres tener más información sobre nosotros y nuestro negocio puedes encontrarnos en digitalvirgo.com




Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst para las regiones de Iberia y LATAM. Este rol es clave para impulsar nuestras estrategias de datos y operaciones analíticas, enfocándose en maximizar el rendimiento empresarial a través de plataformas digitales.




✅ ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones en el día a día?

Formular un plan de seguimiento integral que se alinee con los objetivos comerciales.
Colaborar con desarrolladores web e ingenieros de datos para garantizar la recopilación e integración de datos según el plan de seguimiento.
Implementar configuraciones que permitan empoderar las iniciativas de marketing y publicidad con información procesable.
Generar informes y visualizaciones claras que permitan a los equipos de Marketing y Operaciones Empresariales tomar decisiones informadas basadas en análisis sólidos.
Trabajar estrechamente con desarrolladores y gestores de tráfico para analizar datos y mejorar continuamente el rendimiento de las campañas.
Guiar la evolución de la arquitectura de la plataforma de seguimiento, incluyendo el desarrollo de nuevos modelos de datos y estructuras adaptadas a las necesidades comerciales cambiantes.
Liderar la integración de socios externos que requieran un sólido soporte en datos y análisis.
Colaborar con ingenieros de datos para mejorar el rendimiento técnico y la escalabilidad de nuestras plataformas de datos.




🔎 ¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia mínima de 3 años en una posición similar.
Experiencia demostrable en Looker (+LookML), Looker Studio y Tableau.
Experiencia en la gestión de herramientas de tecnología de marketing como Google Tag Manager, Hightouch, GA Measurement Protocol, Fivetran y Google Ads scripting.
Nivel alto de inglés.




➕ Será un plus si…

Tienes conocimientos en bases de datos SQL, particularmente Google BigQuery y Snowflake.
Aportas conocimientos en Comprensión básica de HTML, JS, CSS, jQuery y PHP.
Conocimientos básicos de Python.




🙌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Buen ambiente laboral.
Formar parte de un equipo en el que te sientas escuchado/a y donde puedas aportar nuevas ideas.
Crecimiento profesional.
Salario competitivo acorde con tus skills.
Beneficios sociales.
Horario flexible de entrada y salida.
Teletrabajo 1+18.
Jornada intensiva viernes y verano.




¡Únete a nuestro equipo! ¡Ésta es tu oportunidad! 👇Si eres una persona con energía, actitud, aprendizaje continuo y muy proactivo envíanos tu CV.

Show more

Si quieres tener más información sobre nosotros y nuestro negocio puedes encontrarnos en digitalvirgo.com


Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst para las regiones de Iberia y LATAM. Este rol es clave para impulsar nuestras estrategias de datos y operaciones analíticas, enfocándose en maximizar el rendimiento empresarial a través de plataformas digitales.


✅ ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones en el día a día?

  • Formular un plan de seguimiento integral que se alinee con los objetivos comerciales.
  • Colaborar con desarrolladores web e ingenieros de datos para garantizar la recopilación e integración de datos según el plan de seguimiento.
  • Implementar configuraciones que permitan empoderar las iniciativas de marketing y publicidad con información procesable.
  • Generar informes y visualizaciones claras que permitan a los equipos de Marketing y Operaciones Empresariales tomar decisiones informadas basadas en análisis sólidos.
  • Trabajar estrechamente con desarrolladores y gestores de tráfico para analizar datos y mejorar continuamente el rendimiento de las campañas.
  • Guiar la evolución de la arquitectura de la plataforma de seguimiento, incluyendo el desarrollo de nuevos modelos de datos y estructuras adaptadas a las necesidades comerciales cambiantes.
  • Liderar la integración de socios externos que requieran un sólido soporte en datos y análisis.
  • Colaborar con ingenieros de datos para mejorar el rendimiento técnico y la escalabilidad de nuestras plataformas de datos.


🔎 ¿Qué buscamos?

  • Experiencia mínima de 3 años en una posición similar.
  • Experiencia demostrable en Looker (+LookML), Looker Studio y Tableau.
  • Experiencia en la gestión de herramientas de tecnología de marketing como Google Tag Manager, Hightouch, GA Measurement Protocol, Fivetran y Google Ads scripting.
  • Nivel alto de inglés.


➕ Será un plus si…

  • Tienes conocimientos en bases de datos SQL, particularmente Google BigQuery y Snowflake.
  • Aportas conocimientos en Comprensión básica de HTML, JS, CSS, jQuery y PHP.
  • Conocimientos básicos de Python.


🙌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Buen ambiente laboral.
  • Formar parte de un equipo en el que te sientas escuchado/a y donde puedas aportar nuevas ideas.
  • Crecimiento profesional.
  • Salario competitivo acorde con tus skills.
  • Beneficios sociales.
  • Horario flexible de entrada y salida.
  • Teletrabajo 1+18.
  • Jornada intensiva viernes y verano.


¡Únete a nuestro equipo! ¡Ésta es tu oportunidad! 👇Si eres una persona con energía, actitud, aprendizaje continuo y muy proactivo envíanos tu CV.

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US




Konecta is a leading innovative global service provider in customer management business process and digital outsourcing, with 120,000 passionate employees working in 30 languages across 4 continents and 26 countries. Focusing on the unique needs and opportunities of each industry, Konecta offers a full range of end-to-end customer management solutions – including acquisition, retention, customer service, technical support, and collection – all based on a sustainable business model. These services are built on a portfolio of world-class expertise covering customer experience and process management, digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies. Headquartered in Madrid, Konecta delivers global revenues of €2 billion with more than 500 clients, covering some of the biggest names in telecoms, energy, banking, mobility, retail, and e-commerce.




MISSION OF THE ROLE




We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Sustainability Data Analyst to support the collection, analysis, and reporting of sustainability data across various domains such as environmental management, employee health and safety, training, and other relevant sustainability areas. This role will involve working closely with teams in different countries to gather data, audit it against evidence, and manage the information in a structured repository. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring compliance with timelines and contributing to process optimization efforts.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Collection: Gather sustainability data across various areas (environmental, employee health and safety, training, etc.) by requesting data from different countries and business units.
Data Auditing & Validation: Perform audits on the data to ensure its accuracy and consistency with the available evidence. Ensure the data is loaded into the existing data repository in a structured manner.
Monitoring Compliance: Track and ensure compliance with the established deadlines for data submission and reporting.
Reporting & Dashboards: Create and maintain reports and dashboards to effectively communicate sustainability performance to internal stakeholders.
Process Optimization Support: Assist in optimizing the processes related to sustainability data collection, management, and reporting to improve efficiency and effectiveness.




REQUIREMENTS

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Google Drive, or other data visualization platforms).
Experience with sustainability data management and reporting tools is a plus.
Knowledge of sustainability-related metrics and frameworks (e.g., environmental impact, health and safety, training metrics) is advantageous.
Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is essential.
Proactivity and the ability to work independently while managing multiple tasks.
Strong analytical skills, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
Problem-solving abilities and a solution-oriented mindset.
Effective communication skills to work across different teams and countries.

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!




Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team’s efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.




You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you’ll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.




You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.




To be successful in the role you must bring:

At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
Emotional resilience: You can give and take criticism well. You don’t get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you’re polite enough to challenge others’ ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don’t know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Participa en innovadores proyectos del sector energía eléctrica, aportando al equipo tu experiencia como Analista de Datos




En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia como analista de datos, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




Principales funciones:




Desarrollo y mantenimiento de herramientas para mantenimiento y construcción (DataFabric).
Creación y mejora de informes en Microsoft Fabric y Denodo.
Seguimiento de planificación anual y actividad en campo.
Asignación de personal (MOP) y control de recursos (materiales y servicios externos).
Gestión de descargos, condicionantes técnicos y riesgos operativos.
Seguimiento económico y reporting.
Apoyo en la implantación del Sistema de Gestión Integrada (PMP/ISO21500, ISO55000, EFQM).
Soporte administrativo: presupuestos, pedidos, contratos, EIMEs y hand over.




¿Qué buscamos?

Formación Académica: Grado / Máster en Ingeniería de Software, Informática, Industrial, Computer Science, Data Analyst, Big Data, Data Science, o similar
Experiencia con PowerBI, QuickSight y SQL para BBDD
Experiencia con SAP R3 y HANA
Valorable experiencia en proyectos sector eléctrico relacionados con instalaciones eléctricas




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.

Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 217 millones de euros, 9 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.240 personas.

Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Title: Analista People Data - Power BI
Description:
¡Crecemos juntos! 🚀 ✨




Si eres una persona entusiasta y buscas un nuevo reto profesional ¡Este es tu sitio!




Buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Analista People Data, para incorporase con nosotros/as en nuestras oficinas de 📍Madrid en modalidad híbrida.




¡Anímate a dar el salto!¡Te estamos esperando!




Responsabilidades:

· Utilizar SAP para la gestión y extracción de datos empresariales. Experiencia en el uso de BW y/o DataLake es valorable.

· Manipulación de datos en Excel, preferiblemente en Power Query, para la creación de informes estratégicos.

· Crear informes y visualizaciones en Power BI para apoyar la toma de decisiones.

· Colaborar con el People Analytics Manager para la realización de análisis detallados para identificar tendencias y oportunidades de mejora.

· Garantizar la precisión y calidad de los datos manejados.




Requisitos:

· Hasta dos años de experiencia en el uso de SAP, BW o DataLake.

· Experiencia en el uso de Power BI y Power Query.

· Valorable experiencia de programación en Python.

· Excelentes habilidades analíticas y atención al detalle.

· Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y comunicarse eficazmente.

· Nivel B2 de inglés.




Ofrecemos un camino lleno de aventuras:

🔹 ¡Llega hasta donde tú quieras! Crece con nuestros programas de desarrollo! Te ayudaremos a marcar tu itinerario de futuro anualmente participando en proyectos vanguardistas con los mejores profesionales del sector.

🔹 Porque lo importante sois tú y los tuyos : contamos con políticas que facilitan la conciliación entre la vida profesional y personal: Flexibilidad horaria, Smart Job y jornada intensiva en verano.

🔹 Tú decides cómo usar tu dinero: disfruta de nuestra retribución flexible, contamos con: Seguro médico, Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte.

🔹 Plan Bienestar descuentos en viajes, tecnología, formación, deporte, belleza y ¡muchos más.

🔹 Diviértete participando en los diferentes concursos y actividades que organizamos: ¿te gusta el deporte, escribir, la fotografía? Todo tiene cabida.

🔹¡Actualízate! apostamos por un aprendizaje continuo, contamos con formación especializada, certificaciones e idiomas.

🔹¡Deja tu huella! Impacta con nuestros proyectos de voluntariado social.

¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo! 💫🌎

Title: CS Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ’s success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you’ll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they’re probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our Senior Analytics Executives.

Our clients trust our Insights Analysts, coming to them when they have challenges and questions. These questions range from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ’s Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world’s best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

We are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights and deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients, helping them grow their business.

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients’ teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients’ needs and then create and present solutions that help those clients achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

Our team has a wide range of backgrounds and skill sets. Some of us have backgrounds in data, some in marketing, and others in sales. We are looking for someone who is keen to bring their excellent story-telling skills to a modern, data environment.

If telling stories through data excites you but you’re uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understanding Client Needs:


Understanding client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover


Delivering Insight:


Become a category expert; be curious and engage with the client industry, their categories and key market trends
Being prepared to challenge client hypothesis and bring a new perspective
Make recommendations based on rigorous analysis leveraging multiple data sources, sound business understanding and commercial awareness.


Workload Management and Prioritization:


Manages workload independently and effectively prioritizes client commitments alongside internal commitments.
Maintains a clear communication pathway with the key stakeholders
Maintains and delivers work log trackers and project plans where applicable


REQUIREMENTS


Engaging presenter with 5-7 years of experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
Confident numerically
Ability to analyze data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint
Experience in using Home Panel data is a plus
Native in Spanish and good level of English


WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world’s populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry’s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what’s possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape Spanish retail


Additional Information

This is a full time role based in Madrid offering a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ’s success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you’ll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they’re probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our Senior Analytics Executives.

Our clients trust our Insights Analysts, coming to them when they have challenges and questions. These questions range from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ’s Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world’s best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

We are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights and deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients, helping them grow their business.

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients’ teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients’ needs and then create and present solutions that help those clients achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

Our team has a wide range of backgrounds and skill sets. Some of us have backgrounds in data, some in marketing, and others in sales. We are looking for someone who is keen to bring their excellent story-telling skills to a modern, data environment.

If telling stories through data excites you but you’re uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understanding Client Needs:

  • Understanding client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals
  • Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
  • Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover

Delivering Insight:

  • Become a category expert; be curious and engage with the client industry, their categories and key market trends
  • Being prepared to challenge client hypothesis and bring a new perspective
  • Make recommendations based on rigorous analysis leveraging multiple data sources, sound business understanding and commercial awareness.

Workload Management and Prioritization:

  • Manages workload independently and effectively prioritizes client commitments alongside internal commitments.
  • Maintains a clear communication pathway with the key stakeholders
  • Maintains and delivers work log trackers and project plans where applicable

REQUIREMENTS

  • Engaging presenter with 5-7 years of experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
  • Confident numerically
  • Ability to analyze data confidently
  • Problem solving and solutions orientated
  • Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
  • Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
  • Experience of working in an analytical environment
  • An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
  • Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience in using Home Panel data is a plus
  • Native in Spanish and good level of English

WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world’s populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry’s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what’s possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:

  • Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
  • Career & Learning development
  • Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
  • Becoming an expert in categories that shape Spanish retail

Additional Information

This is a full time role based in Madrid offering a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients.

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🔍 Empower Data, Drive Insight, and Elevate Decision-Making – Right from Madrid! 🇪🇸




Are you someone who gets excited about turning raw data into real impact? 📊 At FERO, we're on the lookout for a Junior Data Analyst who's eager to dig deep into data, support internal reporting, investigate issues, and bring clarity to complex questions across teams—from ops and product to sales and customer success. You’ll be a key player in driving data excellence, supporting strategic decisions, and helping us grow smarter, faster. 🚀




Who We Are

We're FERO, a high-growth startup reinventing the checkout and payment experience 💳 to help our customers increase conversions and revenue. Backed by top-tier VCs, we’re building our future from the heart of Madrid, combining cutting-edge tech 🖥️ with a collaborative, data-driven culture.




We offer:




💰 Competitive pay

🩻 Half sponsored Private Health Insurance

✨ The chance to make a real difference in an environment that values curiosity, creativity, and impact




What You'll Do




🔎 Investigate and Analyse: Support incident investigations and root-cause analyses with data insights and exploratory analysis.

🤝 Enable Sales & Success Teams: Help prepare data-driven materials and insights for customer proof-of-concepts and strategic conversations.

🧹 Push Data Quality: Help monitor data pipelines, identify inconsistencies, and contribute to cleaner, more reliable datasets.

📊 Internal Reporting & Dashboards: Help design and maintain reports that provide clear visibility into key business metrics.

🔗 Work Cross-Functionally: Collaborate with engineering, product, and business stakeholders to answer critical questions and support decision-making.

📚 Build Data Culture: Help foster data literacy and support the adoption of better data practices throughout the company.




What We Offer




🧠 Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge solutions in a greenfield setting.

🌱 Growth Opportunities: Join us early and grow with us professionally and personally.

🤗 Collaborative Culture: Be part of a friendly, creative, and supportive team.

🏠 Flexible Work: Hybrid model - 3 days in office, 2 days WFH.

💼 Competitive Compensation: Great pay, employee equity, and private health insurance partially sponsored by FERO.

Who You Are

🧐 Analytically Curious: You love exploring messy datasets, spotting patterns, and figuring out what the data really says.

🐍 Python Fluent: Comfortable using Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) for data cleaning, analysis, and basic visualisations.

🗣️ Clear Communicator: Able to present findings in a structured, simple, and actionable way - both in writing and in conversation.

🔍 Detail-Oriented: You have an eye for accuracy and consistency when working with data.

🤝 Collaborative & Proactive: You enjoy working in a team and aren’t afraid to ask questions or speak up with ideas.

🚀 Eager to Grow: You’re hungry to learn and ready to grow in both technical and business dimensions.

✅ Eligible to Work in Spain




Ready to Join Us?

Excited to make a difference? 💥 Send us your English CV and let's get started on this amazing journey together! 🎉

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡Hola Data Lover! 💙




¿Estás en último curso o acabas de finalizar tus estudios en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Ciencia de datos, Industriales u otra salida académica similar?




¿Quieres llevar tus habilidades en Data, Analytics & IA al siguiente nivel? 🚀.




Somos líderes globales, trabajamos con la mitad del IBEX-35 y no paramos de crecer desde 1994.

Si te apasionan los datos, ¡únete a nosotrxs! ✨📊




¿Cuál será tu misión?




Te involucrarás desde el principio en proyectos reales de Data, realizando tanto el análisis técnico, la transformación de datos y el desarrollo de cuadros de mando para los departamentos de negocio de nuestros clientes.







¿Cómo podrás hacerlo?




Aprendiendo todo lo posible a nivel técnico y, poco a poco, te haremos ganar confianza en ti mismo e irás contando con la capacidad de gestionar tu propio tiempo y cada vez trabajar con mayor autonomía.
Te encargarás también de la redacción de la documentación del proyecto en el que participes.
Participarás en el análisis funcional de los proyectos, lo que te permitirá entender el negocio y tener una visión global y mayor conocimiento de los clientes.
Irás ganando mayor conocimiento y responsabilidad lo que te permitirá participar en más fases de los distintos proyectos. Participarás en el diseño y desarrollo de cuadros de mando desde cero al igual que en el diseño y desarrollo de procesos de modelado de dato y transformación de datos con tecnologías y herramientas específicas de ETL on-premise y cloud.
Te encargarás de la formación a usuarios de negocio con el fin de que el cliente sepa interpretar los datos de la mejor manera posible. Por ello, tendrás un mayor posicionamiento de cara al cliente con constante interlocución y dando soluciones a sus necesidades.
Te mantendrás actualizado en las últimas tendencias tecnológicas en el ámbito de Data & Analytics para poder ofrecer las mejores soluciones a nuestros clientes.







🚀 ¿Qué nos hace únicxs?




Aquí no somos una empresa más... ¡somos un equipo que va a por todas! 💡✨




🔹 La tecnología y los datos son nuestra esencia. No solo trabajamos con lo último del mercado, sino que te formaremos para que domines las herramientas más innovadoras. Contamos con un área de innovación donde exploramos nuevas alianzas con gigantes tecnológicos y centros de I+D.




🔹 Tú marcas el ritmo. Olvídate de estructuras rígidas. Cada semestre, te sentarás con tu responsable para hablar de tus logros, nuevos retos y… ¡ajustes salariales en base a resultados!




🔹 Desde el minuto 1, serás parte de nuestra familia. Aquí nadie camina solx. Siempre habrá un compañerx dispuesto a ayudarte. 🤝😃




🔹 Aprenderás de lxs mejores. Te codearás con cracks del sector (tanto técnicos como de negocio), que estarán encantadxs de compartir su conocimiento y celebrar tu crecimiento. 📈🔥




🔹 Somos una empresa con propósito. Creemos en la diversidad y la inclusión como motores de la creatividad, lo que nos permite superar cualquier desafío. 🌍💜




📌 Y, por si fuera poco…




✅ Contrato indefinido (¡queremos que te quedes mucho tiempo!)

✅ Jornada intensiva en julio y agosto 🏖️

✅ Salario competitivo según tu formación y experiencia

✅ Apoyo económico para el teletrabajo 💻🏡







Si buscas un lugar donde crecer, innovar y sentirte parte de algo grande… ¡este es tu sitio! 🚀💥

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando 1 perfil de Data Analyst Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis Spain donde llevamos a cabo importantes proyectos de Inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura con clientes nacionales e internacionales, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




REQUISITOS TÉCNICOS

Experiencia demostrable en el uso de Power BI para la creación de informes y dashboards.
Conocimientos sólidos en modelado de datos y lenguaje DAX.
Familiaridad con bases de datos relacionales y consultas en SQL.
Capacidad para analizar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer insights relevantes.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación.
Valorable contar con certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.
Valorable contar con experiencia en herramientas de ETL y procesos de integración de datos.
Valorable contar con conocimientos en otras herramientas de visualización de datos.




RESPONSABILIDADES

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para comprender los requisitos de negocio y traducirlos en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Optimizar modelos de datos y consultas para mejorar el rendimiento de los informes.
Garantizar la calidad y precisión de los datos presentados en los dashboards.
Proporcionar soporte y formación a usuarios finales sobre el uso de Power BI.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto desde cualquier punto de España.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly analytical and data-driven Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will transform raw data into actionable insights, helping optimize operational efficiency and support decision-making processes. You should be passionate about metrics, monitoring, and automation—always looking for ways to improve efficiency through data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Collection & Processing


Gather and integrate data from multiple sources into complex models.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency through validation and cleansing.
Automate data extraction and transformation processes to enhance efficiency.


Data Analysis & Visualization


Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to generate insights and forecasts.
Develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports for clear, impactful data communication.


Performance Monitoring & Reporting


Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.
Generate regular performance reports to highlight progress and opportunities for improvement.
Optimize Power BI reports for scalability and sustainability across large datasets.


Cross-Functional Collaboration


Work closely with different teams to deliver data-driven solutions.
Participate in interdisciplinary projects requiring analytics and actionable insights.
Act as a subject matter expert in data analytics, supporting and guiding colleagues.


Qualifications


Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Power BI, including:
Report development
Data modeling & dataflows
DAX calculations & Power Query
Experience creating interactive Power BI reports from multiple data sources.
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric (preferred).
Data & metrics-driven mindset – comfortable with both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Strong analytical background, capable of working in ambiguous situations.
Strong business communication skills, with the ability to write compelling proposals.
Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus).


If you are a proactive, results-oriented data analyst with a passion for transforming data into strategic insights, we’d love to hear from you!

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (Stock Options also included).
📍 Amazing centrally located offices near the Bernabeu Stadium.
🩺 Private Health Insurance (Sanitas) and daily meal vouchers of 11 EUR will be entirely covered by us.
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 23 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Up to 25 EUR per month for a gym subscription.
🛴 Flexible retribution plan for kindergarten & transport tickets.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement of up to 50% of the cost of English & Spanish classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, soft drinks and protein shakes at the office.
🍕 Regular company and team events like Pizza talks, Team Building activities, Christmas parties, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.


Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly analytical and data-driven Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will transform raw data into actionable insights, helping optimize operational efficiency and support decision-making processes. You should be passionate about metrics, monitoring, and automation—always looking for ways to improve efficiency through data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Collection & Processing

  • Gather and integrate data from multiple sources into complex models.
  • Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency through validation and cleansing.
  • Automate data extraction and transformation processes to enhance efficiency.

Data Analysis & Visualization

  • Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
  • Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to generate insights and forecasts.
  • Develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports for clear, impactful data communication.

Performance Monitoring & Reporting

  • Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.
  • Generate regular performance reports to highlight progress and opportunities for improvement.
  • Optimize Power BI reports for scalability and sustainability across large datasets.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Work closely with different teams to deliver data-driven solutions.
  • Participate in interdisciplinary projects requiring analytics and actionable insights.
  • Act as a subject matter expert in data analytics, supporting and guiding colleagues.

Qualifications

  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Power BI, including:
  • Report development
  • Data modeling & dataflows
  • DAX calculations & Power Query
  • Experience creating interactive Power BI reports from multiple data sources.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric (preferred).
  • Data & metrics-driven mindset – comfortable with both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
  • Strong analytical background, capable of working in ambiguous situations.
  • Strong business communication skills, with the ability to write compelling proposals.
  • Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus).

If you are a proactive, results-oriented data analyst with a passion for transforming data into strategic insights, we’d love to hear from you!

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

  • 💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (Stock Options also included).
  • 📍 Amazing centrally located offices near the Bernabeu Stadium.
  • 🩺 Private Health Insurance (Sanitas) and daily meal vouchers of 11 EUR will be entirely covered by us.
  • 🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
  • 🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 23 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
  • 🤸 Up to 25 EUR per month for a gym subscription.
  • 🛴 Flexible retribution plan for kindergarten & transport tickets.
  • 🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement of up to 50% of the cost of English & Spanish classes.
  • 🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, soft drinks and protein shakes at the office.
  • 🍕 Regular company and team events like Pizza talks, Team Building activities, Christmas parties, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
  • 📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
  • 🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Analista Gobierno y Calidad del Dato
Description:
Job Description

¿Por qué te estamos buscando?

Tu misión será impulsar el Gobierno y Calidad del Dato en Mahou San Miguel trabajando activamente con las diferentes Áreas Usuarias en la gestión adecuada de los activos de datos para asegurar el uso y explotación de datos de confianza.

Tu día a día en Mahou San Miguel


Trabajar en una metodología de metadatado y estandarización de requisitos de gobierno del dato.
Evolucionar los marcos sobre los que se establece el gobierno del dato, los requerimientos, responsables y valores mínimos para considerar un dato gobernado.
Impulsar y participar en la mejora de las capacidades para la gestión del dato.
Desarrollar la metodología de calidad del dato y su implementación en modelos de control, alertado y cuadros de mando.
Gestionar, administrar y actualizar los contenidos en las herramientas de gobierno y calidad de datos, dando soporte a las Áreas Usuarias y participando en las iniciativas intensivas en datos para garantizar que cumplen con los procedimientos y requisitos y de gobierno y calidad de datos.


¿Qué requisitos debes cumplir?


Grado, Licenciatura, Ingeniería Superior o FPII
Nivel alto de inglés
Al menos 2 años de experiencia en gestión o implantación de iniciativas de gobierno de datos y calidad de datos. Se valorará positivamente experiencia en consultoría.
Experiencia en la definición de procedimientos de gobierno del dato y en la definición e implantación de metodologías de definición de controles de calidad del dato y modelos de calidad del dato.
1-2 años de experiencia en el uso de herramientas de gobierno de datos y calidad del dato.
Valorable experiencia en la plataforma de Stratio y en sector Gran Consumo.
Capacidad de interlocución con negocio, gestión de proyectos, proveedores a nivel técnico y planificación.


La diversidad, clave en nuestra estrategia

Nuestro compromiso con la diversidad, la inclusión y la igualdad de oportunidades está presente desde nuestro nacimiento en 1890. Nuestra visión, en este sentido, es “construir el futuro a través de la suma de personas únicas, impulsando la diversidad de forma activa como fuente de riqueza en la sociedad”.

Por eso, esta oferta está dirigida a cualquier persona que reúna los requisitos exigidos para el puesto, independientemente de sus características.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Operador multienergético del mercado español, especializado en el trading de hidrocarburos y referente en el almacenamiento de combustibles y derivados en el sur de Europa.

Debido a la expansión y crecimiento de la compañía, estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst para analizar y optimizar los datos con el fin de mejorar la toma de decisiones comerciales.




Funciones principales:

Gestionar la plataforma Salesforce para el análisis de datos para generar insights estratégicos.
Asegurar la calidad y precisión de los datos en los distintos módulos de Salesforce.
Crear y mantener informes y dashboards personalizados en Salesforce. Presentación de datos para facilitar la toma de decisiones comerciales.
Automatizar reportes para mejorar la eficiencia del análisis de datos y automatizar flujos de trabajo y procesos mediante herramientas nativas (Flow, Process Builder) o personalizadas (Apex, Lightning).
Optimizar los flujos de trabajo y procesos dentro de Salesforce para mejorar la productividad del equipo de ventas.
Apoyar en la configuración y personalización de Salesforce para alinearlo con los objetivos de la empresa.
Coordinar la integración de Salesforce con otras herramientas y bases de datos.
Administrar la migración y sincronización de datos entre sistemas.
Garantizar la seguridad y el cumplimiento normativo en la gestión de la información.
Colaborar con stakeholders técnicos y de negocio para asegurar la alineación entre la tecnología y los objetivos estratégicos.
Garantizar el cumplimiento de buenas prácticas en ciberseguridad, gobernanza de datos y calidad del software




Requisitos:

Experiencia de 3 años en en data analyst.
Experiencia demostrable de 3 años trabajando con CRM Salesforce.
Experiencia liderando proyectos tecnológicos (con metodología Agile o híbrida).
Certificaciones valoradas: Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Platform App Builder, DP-900 (Azure Data Fundamentals), PL-900 (Power Platform).

Title: Insights Analyst - Temporary
Description:
With two centuries of family heritage, Suntory Global Spirits is a world leader in premium spirits. As a truly global business, we bring together the best of our culturally diverse heritage. We value both agility and long-term thinking; we share a collective commitment to excellence and a dedication to craftsmanship. Across borders and roles, we collaborate to delight our consumers responsibly whilst contributing to a more sustainable society for all our stakeholders.




Our Vision is Growing for Good, and our mission is to be the world’s most admired, fastest-growing premium spirits company. We’re a business that runs on responsibility, integrity, ambition and drive, and we celebrate exceptional performance. We welcome our people to dream big and tenaciously pursue ambitious goals – we call it our Yatte Minahare Spirit.







Insights Analyst (Temporary)

This role is open in Madrid, Spain.







What makes this a great opportunity?

The Insights Analyst skillfully creates appropriate methodologies, execute primary research (quantitative and qualitative), to vividly bring alive consumer understanding / insight that inspires big ideas and delivers profitable brand growth. Equip the marketing/trade teams with an understanding of their performance. Bring the consumer to life as part of the activity development process (e.g. creative briefing) and is a key contributor to the Consumer Planning & Insights team, looking for “Simpler, Faster, Better” ways to deliver value to the business.







Role Responsibilities

Consumer understanding: Delivering the learning plan for the brand. Accountable for identifying and driving the brand consumer agenda. Conducts insights and research for Spain Market: qualitative fieldwork and quantitative studies; running projects end-to-end (many times with minimal supervision). Support the day-to-day project management needs across a wide variety of research methodologies and suppliers.
Category & brand strategy and activity planning: Leads, in partnership with the marketing team, a robust situation assessment for the Brand as input into the annual strategy process and activity planning. Provide day-to-day consumer insights and business intelligence consulting support for brand and sales team members. Ensuring the brand / trade teams understand consumer reasons for performance (using tracker, sales data, trends data etc), and act on the implications of that understanding.
Integrated brand communication: Supports the development of creative and media briefing process alongside the brand and agency partners. Ensures that the consumer programs and creative assets are informed by the most current and relevant Insights and testing protocols.
Insights & resource management: Responsible for designing and executing consumer and market research in connection with the marketing teams to: identify emerging consumer behaviors, wants, and needs; new consumer segments (now, next and future); market trends (micro, macro and mega), and analyzing competitive activity. Partner with local data and key platform providers (e.g. Nielsen) for brand/market -specific projects as needed – as well as leveraging the global insight tools, platforms and data, where possible. Accountable for managing brand research spend to deliver targeted savings and on budget Ensures that the consumer programs and creative assets are informed by the most current and relevant Insights and testing protocols.
Business performance management: Builds an extensive understanding of Measure & Evaluation for the brand to drive more effective marketing planning. Integration of CMI sources in to Quarterly/Monthly Business Reviews. Management of relationship and day to day interaction with external partners (Nielsen, etc...). Responsible for training new users and the ongoing capability building for users in CMI tools (Nielsen, Answers, Clickview, Kantar)







Qualifications

5+ years of experience of commercial/ business analytics with strong application experience (Client Side)
Bachelor’s degree (Masters preferred) in Business Analytics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics / Statistics /Computer Science
Proven experience in synthesizing and driving business impact utilizing information from multiple disparate sources (including but not limited to Nielsen NIQ data, distributor data, first-party retailer data)
Passionate about Consumer Insights, data and Market trends
Analytical and strategic mindset to think about the near- and longer-term team and evolution of analytics capabilities
Proficiency visualization tools / BI / analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI) is required
Strong communication and presentation skills with proven track record of using insights to influence executive sand colleagues to action
Ability to work independently and strong sense of individual accountability. Works with fair level of autonomy, is able to prioritize, but knows when to escalate problems
High degree of numeracy and analysis
Experience of managing multiple projects simultaneously / multi-tasking .
Industry experience in AlcBev is a plus







At SGS, people are our number one priority! We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive environment. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant’s skills and experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Landbot is the most powerful no-code chatbot builder. Our platform helps thousands of companies convert leads, capture data, and personalize customer journeys in real time.

Our Core Values

🎯 The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team!! 🚀

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.

🔍 Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities


Insight Generation & Experimentation:
Collaborate with product development teams to ensure the product is correctly instrumented, and that the operational data models allow the exploitation of our data for analytics purposes.
Analyze data from various sources to draw insights and support decision-making.
Collaborate with business and product teams to identify key metrics and derive actionable insights.
Collaborate with product managers in identifying opportunities, formulating hypotheses and validating them via experimentation.
Analytics Engineering:
Ensure data freshness, integrity and consistency within the data warehouse.
Develop & Maintain ELT processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the warehouse.
Define and maintain usable reports and metrics, enabling self-service from the stakeholders.
Design, develop or help develop visualizations and dashboards tailored to the needs of different teams.
Data Activation:
Integrate data warehouse with third-party tools to activate the data for marketing, customer success, and/or sales.
Ensure the accuracy and timeliness of data feeds to these tools.
Promote data literacy and data informedness with stakeholders



🌟 What Makes This Role Exciting?


Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.
Gain visibility into all company departments, learning from a variety of business areas.
Be part of a fast-growing, international company with a strong tech focus.



🛠 Must-Have Requirements


2-3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Analytical Thinking
Description: Ability to break down complex problems or datasets and derive meaningful insights.
Example: Identifying trends in user behavior from product data and suggesting actionable strategies for the product team.
Technical Proficiency:
Description: Proficient in data warehousing technologies, ETL/ELT processes, SQL, Python, git and data visualization tools. Familiar with development tools (CI/CD, version control, testing).
Example: Successfully integrating a new data source into the warehouse without disrupting existing processes or data. Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Amplitude).
Collaboration:
Description: Ability to work seamlessly with both business and product teams, understanding their unique requirements and delivering tailored insights.
Example: Collaborating with the marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and designing a custom dashboard to track these metrics in real-time.
Delivery:
Description: Assumes responsibility for the priorities assigned and ensures tasks are completed end-to-end. If obstacles arise, proactively seeks assistance rather than letting tasks linger incomplete.
Example: When tasked with a critical data analysis project for the sales team, the data analyst encountered issues with data inconsistency. Instead of delaying the report, she collaborated with developers to address the data issues, ensuring the project was completed on time and met the sales team's requirements.
Excellent communication skills – ability to present data clearly and concisely.
Fluency in English & Spanish.
Eligibility to work in Spain.
Attention to detail – high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.
Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.


🎯 Nice-to-Have Requirements


Experience with dbt, Airflow
Fan of generative AI, especially LLMs
Familiarity with BigQuery, Google Cloud or other data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
Experience in product development, SaaS, or tech industry.



Hiring Process

1️⃣ HR Interview – 20 min

2️⃣ Interview with Hiring Manager - 40 min

3️⃣ Challenge

4️⃣ Team Interview & Challenge Discussion – 60 min

5️⃣ CEO

Benefits


Hybrid culture or full remote (or both!).
Great company culture, we have a young, upbeat, and international work environment.
Flexible schedule.
Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
Training budget 📚 📖
Ticket transport 🚋
🏖 26 days of paid vacation (23 regular days + December 24th & 31st ) 🏖 + One day for your birthday 🎂
English & Spanish lessons 🇬🇧 🇪🇸
Flex compensation with Cobee
Team building activities 🎳🍻🍕
Referral Bonus if you bring other talented people like you.



If you’re ready to take on the challenge and join an industry-leading tech company, we look forward to your application!
Show more

  • Ensure the accuracy and timeliness of data feeds to these tools.
  • Promote data literacy and data informedness with stakeholders


🌟 What Makes This Role Exciting?

  • Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.
  • Gain visibility into all company departments, learning from a variety of business areas.
  • Be part of a fast-growing, international company with a strong tech focus.


🛠 Must-Have Requirements

  • 2-3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company
  • Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
  • Analytical Thinking
    • Description: Ability to break down complex problems or datasets and derive meaningful insights.
    • Example: Identifying trends in user behavior from product data and suggesting actionable strategies for the product team.
  • Technical Proficiency:
    • Description: Proficient in data warehousing technologies, ETL/ELT processes, SQL, Python, git and data visualization tools. Familiar with development tools (CI/CD, version control, testing).
    • Example: Successfully integrating a new data source into the warehouse without disrupting existing processes or data. Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Amplitude).
  • Collaboration:
    • Description: Ability to work seamlessly with both business and product teams, understanding their unique requirements and delivering tailored insights.
    • Example: Collaborating with the marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and designing a custom dashboard to track these metrics in real-time.
  • Delivery:
    • Description: Assumes responsibility for the priorities assigned and ensures tasks are completed end-to-end. If obstacles arise, proactively seeks assistance rather than letting tasks linger incomplete.
    • Example: When tasked with a critical data analysis project for the sales team, the data analyst encountered issues with data inconsistency. Instead of delaying the report, she collaborated with developers to address the data issues, ensuring the project was completed on time and met the sales team's requirements.
  • Excellent communication skills – ability to present data clearly and concisely.
  • Fluency in English & Spanish.
  • Eligibility to work in Spain.
  • Attention to detail – high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.
  • Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.

🎯 Nice-to-Have Requirements

  • Experience with dbt, Airflow
  • Fan of generative AI, especially LLMs
  • Familiarity with BigQuery, Google Cloud or other data warehousing solutions.
  • Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
  • Experience in product development, SaaS, or tech industry.


Hiring Process

1️⃣ HR Interview – 20 min

2️⃣ Interview with Hiring Manager - 40 min

3️⃣ Challenge

4️⃣ Team Interview & Challenge Discussion – 60 min

5️⃣ CEO

Benefits

  • Hybrid culture or full remote (or both!).
  • Great company culture, we have a young, upbeat, and international work environment.
  • Flexible schedule.
  • Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
  • Training budget 📚 📖
  • Ticket transport 🚋
  • 🏖 26 days of paid vacation (23 regular days + December 24th & 31st ) 🏖 + One day for your birthday 🎂
  • English & Spanish lessons 🇬🇧 🇪🇸
  • Flex compensation with Cobee
  • Team building activities 🎳🍻🍕
  • Referral Bonus if you bring other talented people like you.


If you’re ready to take on the challenge and join an industry-leading tech company, we look forward to your application!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Torrejón de Ardoz, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Desde EULEN Flexiplán, nos encontramos en búsqueda de un/a Data Analyst para una multinacional líder en el sector de la movilidad.




Dentro del Departamento de Mantenimiento, tu misión será analizar grandes volúmenes de datos para generar información estratégica que optimice recursos y mejore procesos.




Responsabilidades:

Analizar y transformar datos para identificar patrones y tendencias.
Diseñar informes y visualizaciones para apoyar decisiones estratégicas.
Desarrollar dashboards interactivos y reportes periódicos para monitorear KPIs.
Garantizar la calidad e integridad de los datos.
Gestionar consultas SQL y herramientas de extracción de datos.
Colaborar con IT para optimizar infraestructuras de datos.
Desarrollar modelos predictivos para anticipar necesidades operativas.
Proponer iniciativas estratégicas basadas en datos para mejorar la eficiencia.
Integrar datos externos mediante APIs de manera automatizada y segura.




Requisitos:

Conocimientos de SQL, Python y Power BI o Tableau.
Inglés C1.




Beneficios:

Contrato indefinido.
Modalidad presencial.
Oficinas situadas en Torrejón de Ardoz.




En EULEN Flexiplán apostamos por la diversidad e inclusión de las personas. Por ello, nuestros procesos de selección se basan en la transparencia y la responsabilidad social, ofreciendo igualdad de oportunidades para todxs.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Desde Candee, consultora de talento, estamos gestionando esta posición de Data Analyst para Ufinet 🌎.




¿Qué es UFINET? 🔎




Ufinet es un operador mayorista de fibra óptica neutral de telecomunicaciones.

Brindan conectividad de datos, capacidad e internet por cable óptico principalmente a LATAM.

Proporcionan servicios de conectividad a sus clientes, con amplia cobertura de red y gran capilaridad en las principales ciudades de los 17 países donde operan desde hace más de 25 años.




¿Qué hace que UFINET sea un sitio único? 😍




Según nos ha contado el equipo de UFINET lo mejor de trabajar aquí es:

🌎 Trabajo en equipo: Mucho compañerismo y respeto entre todos. Además de mucho apoyo entre todos los miembros del equipo.

🌎 Crecimiento: Empresa con gran crecimiento, lo que ayuda a potenciar la carrera profesional.

🌎 Aprendizaje: Oportunidad de aprender constantemente nuevas tecnologías y habilidades dando soluciones a proyectos y problemas reales.




¿Cómo será tu equipo? 👯




Formarás parte del equipo de Software y Data. El equipo tiene una línea de Data Analysis y una línea de Data Engineering liderado por sus respectivos Team Leads.




Trabajarás con datos de carácter corporativo, por lo que trabajarás con el equipo de Dirección y con el equipo Financiero.




¿Cuál será tu misión? 🚀




Tu misión será la de liderar el análisis de datos, identificación de necesidades de negocio e implementación del área Corporativa. Tus funciones consistirán en:




Entender y traducir las peticiones relacionadas con data que provengan del equipo corporativo y coordinarte y entenderte con el CFO para poder traducir las peticiones a los informes necesarios.
Capturar los requisitos, definir las métricas y KPIs.
Extracción, limpieza, preparación y estructuración de datos de diferentes sistemas.
Construcción de conjuntos de datos consolidados de diferentes fuentes
Construcción, Maquetación y Publicación de informes para visualización de datos
Desarrollo de descriptiva, analítica avanzada e implementación de modelos estadísticos
Participación en la estrategia del ciclo CI/CD.




¿Qué están buscando? 🕵️‍♀️




Más de 2 años de experiencia en roles con responsabilidades similares.
Tengas experiencia avanzada en SQL, Modelado de Datos, PowerBI, DAX, Power Query y Git.
Que tengas experiencia con Python.
Que estés familiarizado/a con la Metodología Scrum.
Que seas una persona con buenas habilidades de comunicación, que sepa trabajar en equipo.
Son una compañía en constante cambio, por lo que será imprescindible que seas una persona flexible y que se adapte al cambio.
Esperamos que seas una persona proactiva, con ganas de aprender y mejorar de manera continua.
Orientación a resultados y orientación a negocio.
Permiso para trabajar en el país y dominio del español.




Valoraremos positivamente que...

Tengas conocimientos financieros y/o experiencia trabajando con este área.
Cuentes con alguno/s de estos conocimientos: Power Automate, Power Apps, Data Flows, Machine Learning y/o DevOps.
Te defiendas con el inglés (B2).




¿Qué ofrecen? 🍬




Modalidad Híbrida: 2 días de teletrabajo y 3 en oficina por semana.
Oficinas situadas en el barrio de Salamanca, Madrid.
Salario competitivo.
Horario flexible: Entrada de 8h a 11h y horario de salida en consecuencia.
Mes de Agosto con Jornada Intensiva y Reducida.
Ticket Restaurant.
Seguro Médico con Adeslas.
Formación a demanda en función de tu interés/necesidades. Son una compañía abierta a sugerencias de formación, recursos y tecnología. No cuentan con restricciones en este aspecto.




¿Cómo será tu proceso de selección? 📆




Antes de nada, aplica a la vacante 🙂.
Entrevista semi-estructurada: Si cumples los requisitos, tu Talent Agent se pondrá en contacto contigo para que puedas resolver dudas sobre la posición y para empezar a conocerte más allá de tu CV.
Caso práctico: En caso que ambas partes consideréis que hay encaje, te enviaremos un caso práctico para que podamos verte en acción👩🏻‍💻.
Entrevista con Ufinet: Si has bordado el caso, agendaremos una entrevista con la compañía para que puedas entrevistar a tus potenciales empleadores y para que ellos puedan entrevistarte a ti.
Durante todo el proceso tendrás contacto directo con tu Talent Agent para poder resolver cualquier duda o inquietud.




Si has llegado hasta aquí, puedes ser la persona que buscamos. ¡Conectemos!
