Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Resumen




En Bondy, una app social en crecimiento, buscamos un perfil analítico con experiencia en el análisis de datos centrado en el comportamiento de usuarios y producto. Tu misión será transformar datos en insights que mejoren la experiencia del usuario y ayuden a tomar decisiones clave de producto.

 Responsabilidades




Analizar el uso de Bondy pantalla por pantalla, identificando flujos, bloqueos y oportunidades de mejora.
Colaborar con el equipo de UX/UI para optimizar la experiencia del usuario basándose en datos reales.
Diseñar y mantener dashboards con KPIs clave, asegurando calidad y consistencia.
Extraer y transformar datos con SQL desde nuestras bases de datos (AWS RDS).
Generar reportes claros y accionables sobre el comportamiento de los usuarios.
Realizar entrevistas con usuarios para combinar datos cuantitativos y cualitativos.
Proponer nuevas métricas o modelos de seguimiento para funcionalidades nuevas o existentes.

Requisitos




Experiencia previa como analista de datos, idealmente en producto digital o app.
Dominio de SQL (imprescindible).
Conocimiento en visualización de datos (Grafana, Power BI, Appsmith o similares).
Experiencia con bases de datos como MySQL, PostgreSQL o BigQuery.
Sensibilidad por UX/UI: entiendes cómo los datos impactan la experiencia.
Alta atención al detalle y precisión numérica.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación para explicar hallazgos y proponer mejoras.
Disposición para hacer trabajo de campo: entrevistas, observación directa, etc.

Plus (no excluyentes)




Conocimientos de Python (Pandas, SQLAlchemy, etc.)
Experiencia con herramientas de tracking (Firebase, Mixpanel, Amplitude)
Haber trabajado en startups o con equipos de producto ágiles





Perfil ideal




Mentalidad analítica y obsesión por entender al usuario
Autónomo/a, con capacidad para proponer y ejecutar sin supervisión constante
Proactivo/a y con iniciativa para plantear nuevas formas de medir y mejorar
Buena comunicación y ganas de aportar en un entorno colaborativo y en crecimiento
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:


Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices


Continuous Improvement & Documentation:


Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.


Data Quality & Validation:


Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.


Support the Finance team’s evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users’ community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau® (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.
Show more

Title: Product Analyst, Chat
Description:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities


Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more
HTML:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
  • Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
  • Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
  • Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
  • Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.


Skills, Knowledge & Expertise

  • Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
  • Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
  • Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
  • Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
  • Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
  • Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
  • Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
  • Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.


Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.

  • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
  • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
  • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
  • Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
  • Health Insurance


We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst with Python
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in Python, SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing.  For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform! 

This is a full-time position based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product´s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue.  Have one´s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance

Skills and requirements:

+2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query) 
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!

Title: Compliance Data Analyst
Description:
ADP is hiring a Compliance Data Analyst

ADP has adopted a set of privacy principles that serve as the foundation for our global privacy program, which is designed (i) to assist our Clients in meeting their privacy obligations wherever they do business and (ii) to ensure the personal data of our clients and their employees are safely handled by ADP and its third-party payroll providers and other vendors.

In this context, ADP has dedicated Compliance and Legal teams to oversee and support ADP business to comply with all aspects of data privacy laws and regulations that apply to its business operations.

In this role, you will be part of the Compliance team and will assist ADP with continuously complying with its privacy program and specifically, with its Records Information Management (RIM) Policy. More specifically, you will provide data analytics support with identifying risks and gaps in the retention and disposal of our client’s employees data by monitoring and reporting on the organization's data retention performance, under the supervision of the Compliance Director.

What You'll Do

What you can expect on a typical day:

1 – ADP’s End-to-end Data Disposal Process Is Handled Via a Complex Ticketing System, Involving Various Data Disposal Scenarios, Process Steps And Stakeholders. In This Context


You will identify and track accuracy issues with the tickets related to data retention queries, and you will recommend solutions.
You will monitor the ticket queue relating to data retention and data disposal requests and track the progress.
You will collaborate with the relevant support team to ensure timely and accurate ticket resolution.
You will report regularly to management on ticket volume, response times, ticket status and more.
You will recommend improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness for quicker resolutions of the tickets.
You will maintain accurate records and documentation associated with data retention compliance.
You will create periodic data retention statistics for relevant stakeholders & executive board
You will support with regular data audits to ensure the organization is compliant with its data retention policy.


Requirements

2- You will be supporting with compliance assessment activities on our third-party payroll providers to ensure they meet regulatory privacy requirements as well as ADP’s RIM program. More specifically:


You will support with the review of our third-party payroll providers’ annual data retention audit and their subsequent remediations until full completion.
You will perform annual re-certification activities on our third-party payroll providers to ensure their continuous compliance with ADP’s RIM program and will help delivering and tracking annual data retention training for our third-party payroll providers.
You will assist on an ad hoc basis on other compliance related data analytic tasks that may arise within the business as necessary.


To Succeed In This Role


You have a bachelor's degree in data analytics or related fields; and/or, between 1-2 years of proven experience as a compliance-oriented data analyst.
You have good technical and IT infrastructure understanding and are familiar with data governance, data quality, and data management principles.
You have a proficient knowledge of MS Office (especially in Excel), as you will need to use these tools on a daily basis to ensure that you can handle all the above.
You are fluent in English (oral and written).


In Addition


You have analytical mindset with the ability to assess complex information and identify potential compliance risks. We need someone able to understand problems, identify cause-and-effect relationships and potential solutions.
You have a strong attention to detail and a methodical approach to data analysi. We are looking for someone who is able to notice patterns, catch errors, inconsistencies and discrepancies that others may overlook.
You have strong administrative and organizational skills. The role requires performance of various administrative compliance-related tasks such as safekeeping important documents, organizing files, managing databases, tracking activities and report generation. We therefore need someone who:
Has a methodical approach, ensuring that no task is left incomplete, or instructions misunderstood.
Has effective organization and time management skills.
Has the flexibility to manage a variety of tasks and adapt to changing priorities.
You have experience in working in an multinational environment involving multiple stakeholders


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

Title: GESTOR/A SENIOR DIGITAL DATA ANALYST
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

Desde el equipo de Digital Data buscamos generar insights que permitan a CaixaBank impulsar la venta digital y la mejora de la experiencia de cliente. Actualmente estamos buscando un Senior Data Analyst que nos ayude a administrar y analizar las diferentes fuentes de información, permitiendo a CaixaBank mejorar la Web/App de CaixaBank mediante un test-and-learn continuado.

 

Las principales responsabilidades serán:

 

Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares y clientes internos para comprender sus necesidades de datos y proporcionar recomendaciones estratégicas basadas en el análisis de datos.
Desarrollar análisis cuantitativos y cualitativos para impulsar decisiones y estrategias comerciales y de productos, extrayendo información útil y resolviendo problemas comerciales complejos.
Utilizar técnicas de análisis avanzadas para analizar conjuntos de datos grandes y complejos, identificando patrones, tendencias y correlaciones.
Realizar análisis de impacto en cambios de Producto / App, con visión integral desde conversión hasta impacto en métricas de Negocio
Garantizar el cumplimiento, la gobernanza y la calidad de los datos.
Limpiar y preprocesar datos para garantizar su integridad y facilidad de uso con fines de análisis y modelado.
Requisitos mínimos

 

Licenciatura o máster en un grado STEM (ingeniería, estadística, matemáticas, física, …)
Más de 5 años de experiencia laboral relevante como analista de datos, data scientist o puesto similar.
Fuertes habilidades para resolver problemas, con capacidad de pensamiento analítico y crítico.
Orientación a impacto en Negocio y Experiencia Cliente.
Excelentes dotes de comunicación y presentación, con capacidad para explicar conceptos complejos de forma clara y concisa.
Gran dominio de SQL y experiencia en la preparación, consolidación y normalización de datos.
Dominio de herramientas de analítica web (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Amplitude, …)
Competencias clave

 

Demostrada capacidad analítica y de resolución de problemas. 
Flexibilidad para trabajar con autonomía con calendarios ajustados.  
Orientación al detalle y con capacidad de priorización y coordinación de varios proyectos.
Actitud proactiva y capacidad de trabajo en equipo y de forma transversal. 
Resiliencia y capacidad de adaptación a entornos cambiantes y de alta criticidad. 
Comunicación en español e inglés hablado y escrito
¿Qué ofrecemos?

 

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst para Seguimiento de Modelos de Riesgo de Crédito
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en España con más de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicación, espíritu de colaboración y dinamismo. Banco Sabadell ofrece sus servicios a más de 11 millones de clientes contando con una posición privilegiada en el segmento de empresas.




Nuestra razón de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticipándonos y ocupándonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones económicas, a través de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empatía y franqueza.

Y además, lo hacemos mediante una gestión responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.




¡Únete a nosotros!




¿Qué estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo y con iniciativa, que tenga curiosidad y clara orientación a la resolución de problemas, con capacidad analítica y de auto-organización y que sepa trabajar en equipo.




Hablemos del proyecto…




La dirección de Coordinación y Seguimiento de modelos se enmarca en la dirección de modelos regulatorios de riesgo de crédito de Banco Sabadell, la cual es responsable del desarrollo y mantenimiento de los modelos internos de riesgo de crédito usados en capital y provisiones (parámetros y modelos de calificación).




Concretamente, la Dirección de Seguimiento de modelos es responsable de la monitorización recurrente de los modelos internos de riesgo de crédito con el objetivo es asegurar que los modelos desarrollados siguen siendo válidos para su uso e identificar aspectos de mejora en los mismos.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrarán:




Participarás activamente en los seguimientos de modelos regulatorios IRB y modelos de provisiones IFRS9, ayudando en la mejora continua e industrialización de los seguimientos.
Elaborarás cuadros de mando tanto para el seguimiento del performance de los modelos como para otros usos internos.
Participarás en la elaboración de reporting tanto para uso interno (e.g. comités) como externo (e.g. reportes a supervisor).
Elaborarás análisis ad-hoc relacionados con el ámbito de modelos regulatorios y su aplicación para atender peticiones o necesidades tanto internas como del supervisor.
Trabajarás en estrecha relación con distintos stakeholders de la Entidad.




¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en ámbito Técnico (Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Física o similar) o empresarial (ADE, Economía o similar).
Valoraremos positivamente que aportes formación complementaria (Postgrado o Máster) con componente cuantitativo y/o acreditaciones relacionadas con el ámbito financiero como FRM, CEFA o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en modelización, parametrización de modelos de riesgo de crédito y modelos de calificación en sector Banca.
Que estés habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gestión de información, análisis de BBDD y elaboración de informes.
Que conozcas con suficiencia lenguajes de programación estadística (SAS - SQL) y Power BI, así como dominio del paquete Office. Valoraremos conocimientos de otros lenguajes de programación (Phyton, R).
Que aportes un correcto nivel de Inglés (mínimo B2).







Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.




Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.

Show more

Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo y con iniciativa, que tenga curiosidad y clara orientación a la resolución de problemas, con capacidad analítica y de auto-organización y que sepa trabajar en equipo.


Hablemos del proyecto…


La dirección de Coordinación y Seguimiento de modelos se enmarca en la dirección de modelos regulatorios de riesgo de crédito de Banco Sabadell, la cual es responsable del desarrollo y mantenimiento de los modelos internos de riesgo de crédito usados en capital y provisiones (parámetros y modelos de calificación).


Concretamente, la Dirección de Seguimiento de modelos es responsable de la monitorización recurrente de los modelos internos de riesgo de crédito con el objetivo es asegurar que los modelos desarrollados siguen siendo válidos para su uso e identificar aspectos de mejora en los mismos.


Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrarán:


  • Participarás activamente en los seguimientos de modelos regulatorios IRB y modelos de provisiones IFRS9, ayudando en la mejora continua e industrialización de los seguimientos.
  • Elaborarás cuadros de mando tanto para el seguimiento del performance de los modelos como para otros usos internos.
  • Participarás en la elaboración de reporting tanto para uso interno (e.g. comités) como externo (e.g. reportes a supervisor).
  • Elaborarás análisis ad-hoc relacionados con el ámbito de modelos regulatorios y su aplicación para atender peticiones o necesidades tanto internas como del supervisor.
  • Trabajarás en estrecha relación con distintos stakeholders de la Entidad.


¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?


  • Que tengas estudios superiores en ámbito Técnico (Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Física o similar) o empresarial (ADE, Economía o similar).
  • Valoraremos positivamente que aportes formación complementaria (Postgrado o Máster) con componente cuantitativo y/o acreditaciones relacionadas con el ámbito financiero como FRM, CEFA o similar.
  • Experiencia mínima de 2 años en modelización, parametrización de modelos de riesgo de crédito y modelos de calificación en sector Banca.
  • Que estés habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gestión de información, análisis de BBDD y elaboración de informes.
  • Que conozcas con suficiencia lenguajes de programación estadística (SAS - SQL) y Power BI, así como dominio del paquete Office. Valoraremos conocimientos de otros lenguajes de programación (Phyton, R).
  • Que aportes un correcto nivel de Inglés (mínimo B2).



Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.


Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.

Title: Master Data Intern
Description:
About The Job

Cada vez que comemos y bebemos, elegimos el mundo en el que queremos vivir. Creemos que la salud de las personas y del planeta están 100% interconectadas Esto es lo que transmite nuestra visión One Planet One Health. Os invitamos a uniros a nuestra revolución alimentaria con el objetivo de crear un mundo más saludable.

¿Te apasiona el área de Master Data? ¡Únete a nuestro Programa BTheOne y comienza tu andadura!

Tus principales funciones serán


Adquirir los conocimientos básicos del departamento de Master Data desarrollando la capacidad analítica, estratégica y aprendiendo herramientas de la función.
Ayudar a garantizar el mantenimiento de los datos maestros de Clientes para Iberia en MD.
Dar soporte en la coordinación con todos los actores implicados en estos procesos para asegurar la calidad de los datos, la consecución de los timmings marcados y la ejecución de la creación de los códigos en SAP.


About you

No dudes en aplicar si...


Has estudiado un grado en Administración de Empresas, o similar, y tienes interés por los datos.
Tienes nivel avanzado en Excel
Eres una persona orientada al detalle, con facilidad para relacionar conceptos y procesos y con capacidad para poder comunicar con otros departamentos
Dominas el inglés (mínimo B2).
Y sobre todo... tienes muchas ganas de aprender en una multinacional como Danone 🙂


About us

Trabajar en Danone te da la posibilidad de impactar en más de 12 millones de consumidores en España, donde lideramos el ranking de marcas más elegidas en el país.

En Danone trabajarás para hacer realidad una visión "One Planet, One Health" y no importa en qué posición estés para impactar en ella. Aquí tendrás espacio para crear, para emprender, para crecer y sobre todo para ser tú mismx, gracias a nuestra cultura de Diversidad Inclusiva, donde tenemos claro que "nuestras diferencias son las que marcan la diferencia".

Trabajarás con metodologías ágiles, en equipos de alto rendimiento donde aprenderás, influirás y aportarás para conseguir objetivos concretos y así crecer con la compañía.

Queremos que vengas y lo compruebes por ti mismo, pero si antes quieres tener más información haz click aquí para acabar de convencerte danoneespana.es / @danonecareers_es

En Danone estamos 100% comprometidos con garantizar procesos de selección libres de sesgos e igualdad de oportunidades. Para esto hemos formado a todas las personas que participan en ellos. Porque para trabajar con nosotros lo que nos importa es lo que tú puedes aportar y nada más.
Show more

Title: Internship, Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern for our dynamic market Intelligence team.

Responsibilities


Search for opportunities for business development and increase of company's market share in different services
Regular analysis of the company's performance
Convert the information into knowledge in order to increase company's competitiveness
Develop and maintain regulatory databases
Create, update and organize database of potential international customers
Support regional teams across the globe
Attend meetings with sales and business development managers based internationally


Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration / Data Analysis / Economics/ International Business.
Knowledge in Big Data a plus.
Fluent in English, Intermediate in Spanish.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft windows applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
MI tools such as Power Bi, MACRO, Data Scrapping tools are preferred.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Willing to learn.
Proactive, organized, and multitasking with great team spirit.
Mission: At UL, we know why we come to work. Shape the way we approach and deliver our solutions to have a meaningful contribution to society.
People: Be part of our global team and do your best work! Teamwork, open-feedback and our diversity are our drivers to reach our common mission.
Interesting work: The work that goes on inside UL is fuelling the future. It challenges you to try fresh approaches, work autonomously, drive change and gain in-depth experience in your field.
Grow & achieve: Growth and development are part of our DNA. Grow & achieve with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as your very own UL University.
This is our normal: Competitive remuneration, annual bonus, flexible hours, home office options, paid annual leave.


About Us

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions (NYSE: ULS) transforms safety, security and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 110 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers’ product innovation and business growth. The UL Mark serves as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers’ products and reflects an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. Our science is your advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Scientist / Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Scientist / Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Data Modelling - Time Series forecasting, A/B Testing
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Scientist or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

Additional Information

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst EMEA, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo’s high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark…)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers’ performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization…)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams…) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years’ experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
A Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.) is preferred, but equivalent practical experience will also be considered.
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy…)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Estás preparado para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas…




🛸 ¿Quiénes somos? 🛸




Somos una empresa internacional con más de 18 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática.




Con más de 3000 Primers operando en 4 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Energía e Infraestructuras




Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo:




ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL







🕵🏽‍ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽‍




2/3 años de experiencia como Data Analyst participando en la extracción, transformación y análisis de datos (ETL).
Experiencia en MS Power BI.
Conocimiento de Azure Analytics, especialmente desde el enfoque de Microsoft Fabric.
Manejo de la suite Qlik.
Experiencia en modelado de datos, incluyendo modelado dimensional.
Conocimiento en integración de datos a través de APIs REST.
Dominio del lenguaje SQL para análisis y transformación de datos.




¡¡Y lo más importante de todo que realmente estés motivado para un cambio!!




🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀




Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Desde el proceso de selección, tu incorporación y hasta nuestro desarrollo profesional te ofrecemos

un acompañamiento y un seguimiento personalizado en todo momento. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. Pinta bien, ¿verdad?




Estamos seguros de que ya sabes qué es lo que muchas empresas te ofrecen y como nosotros estamos a la altura:




· Vas a contar con un plan de carrera, crecimiento, proyección y desarrollo profesional personalizado

· Tendrás acceso a formación continua para que puedas estar al día.

· Podrás participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales con opción a movilidad.

· No todo va a ser trabajar, por eso disfrutar de la tarjeta restaurante y seguro médico nos parece esencial.




¡¡¡Teambuildings, afterworks y muchas más sorpresas!!!




¡Te esperamos!

Title: Analista de Datos Junior – Especialista en Excel y Power Query
Description:
Analista de Datos Junior – Especialista en Excel y Power Query

📍 Ubicación: Comercial Escolà

💼 Contrato: Indefinido

🕒 Horario: Lunes a viernes, 9:00 - 18:00




Sobre nosotros

En Comercial Escolà, empresa con más de 50 años de experiencia en la venta y distribución de vinos y destilados en toda España, estamos en plena transformación digital. Por eso, buscamos incorporar un Analista de Datos Junior para dar soporte a nuestro equipo de Business Intelligence.




A quién buscamos?

Buscamos a una persona con un nivel avanzado de Excel y Power Query, que quiera dar el salto al análisis de datos.




No es necesario que tengas experiencia previa como analista, pero sí que domines Excel y lo hayas utilizado en un entorno profesional.




Si has trabajado con grandes volúmenes de datos en Excel, manejando tablas dinámicas, funciones avanzadas y Power Query en tu día a día, esta es tu oportunidad para evolucionar hacia el análisis de datos.




🚨 Solo se considerarán perfiles con formación en:

✔ ADE, Economía, Estadística o estudios similares.

✖ No buscamos perfiles de Ingeniería, Matemáticas o Física.




¿Qué harás en tu día a día?

🔹 Recopilar información de bases de datos, archivos y plataformas digitales.

🔹 Transformar y modelar datos con Power Query y Excel.

🔹 Crear informes y dashboards en Power BI.

🔹 Identificar patrones y tendencias clave en los datos.

🔹 Colaborar con el equipo comercial, clientes y proveedores.

🔹 Realizar seguimiento y análisis de acuerdos comerciales.

🔹 Proponer mejoras basadas en datos para optimizar procesos.




Requisitos

✅ Dominio avanzado de Excel y Power Query (se realizará prueba técnica).

✅ Conocimientos básicos o interés en Power BI y SQL.

✅ Formación en ADE, Economía, Estadística o similares.

✅ Experiencia previa utilizando Excel en un entorno profesional.

✅ Proactividad, autonomía y ganas de aprender.

✅ Nivel nativo o bilingüe de español.

✅ Valorable ubicación cerca

🎯 Valorable: Experiencia en distribución, hostelería o sectores similares.




Lo que ofrecemos

✨ Contrato indefinido y estabilidad laboral.

📈 Oportunidad real de crecimiento en el mundo del análisis de datos.

🍷 Descuento de empleado en nuestros productos.

💡 Formar parte de proyectos innovadores con grandes marcas.

🏢 Ambiente dinámico y colaborativo en una empresa con gran trayectoria.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🚀At Capgemini Invent, we drive change through inventive transformation consulting, blending strategic, creative, and scientific capabilities to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to tailor transformations to our clients' challenges, validated by science and data, powered by creativity and design, and underpinned by purposeful technology.




Your Role

As a Junior Data Analyst professional, you will guide organizations in managing and leveraging their data assets to drive strategic business outcomes. Your focus will be on data quality, security, governance, and metadata management among others fields of practices.




🌐Key responsibilities:

Advising clients on data governance frameworks, data ethics policies, metadata management strategies, and master data management (MDM) solutions.
Integrating cutting-edge technologies into data management processes, leveraging machine learning and advanced analytics.
Shaping and executing engagements in Data Management, including Data Governance, Data Ethics, Data modeling, Data Architecture, Data Quality, and standards implementation.
Conducting assessments of clients' data maturity using frameworks like DCAM and DAMA.
Cultivating trusted client relationships to address key challenges in data management, analytics, and AI delivery.
Providing strategic counsel on maximizing the value of data-driven insights for business decision-making.
Supporting large-scale data transformations from conceptualization to implementation.
Collaborating with stakeholders to facilitate innovation initiatives.
Establishing robust data capabilities within client organizations, including process optimization and skills development.
Contributing to the development of our practice by identifying new market opportunities and creating thought leadership content.




💡Your Profile:

Innovation: Ability to drive innovation in data management using cutting-edge technologies as Informatica or Collibra.
Value-Creation: Creating tangible value through effective data management and utilization of data assets.
Leadership: Potential as a leader in data management with relevant experience and success.
Strategic Thinking: Providing strategic guidance on data management and roadmap creation.
Stakeholder Management: Strong engagement skills with diverse stakeholders, discovering business needs.
Communication Skills: Effective communication to represent the company in data strategy discussions.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying abreast of advancements in data strategy and management.
Delivery: Track record of delivering within agile working environments.




🌟What You'll Love About Working Here

Join our rapidly growing Data & AI Strategy team at Capgemini Invent, where we design and build strategies to transform how organizations leverage data. Our commitment to innovation and AI-driven solutions creates unparalleled value for clients.




We offer flexibility, a positive work-life balance, through hybrid working (80%) and wellbeing options for our employees.




📍Location: Barcelona




Are you ready to take your career to the next level and drive the future of innovation with data?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master’s degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.




If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.




We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data analyst you will:




Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




For us, a Data analyst is someone who:




Knows about:




Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes




Can:




Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.




Loves to:




Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.




Defines himself/herself as a:




A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues’ needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RIÑG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

  • Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
  • Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
  • Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.


What are we looking for?


Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!


For us, a Data analyst is someone who:


Knows about:


  • Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
  • 3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
  • Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
  • Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
  • Fluent English (spoken and written)
  • Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes


Can:


  • Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.


Loves to:


  • Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
  • Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.


Defines himself/herself as a:


  • A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.


What do we offer?


The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.


Check out what is waiting for you!


Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues’ needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.


Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.


Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!


Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).


Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.


Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…


Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.


Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!


More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RIÑG.

International Remote work program.



Get to know Us


We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.


A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.


And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.


We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.


And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.


Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Tienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podrías asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estarás en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de quién seas o cuál sea tu función, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misión: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor diseñado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el éxito de los demás. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una dirección nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente estés pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Además de grandes compañeros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonomía y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitirá alcanzar el éxito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

🤸🏽‍♂️ Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliación y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una política que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 días al año. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

🏁 La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos rápido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de enseñanza y aprendizaje. Y tendrás sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

🌈 Nuestra fórmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros médicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aquí para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, así que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Te incorporarás como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que están afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempeño y resultados en ventas y en retención de pólizas.

En concreto, trabajarás con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversión online


Analizar los factores que impactan la conversión del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra página web por los diferentes canales, apoyándote en el análisis detallado de datos y en las herramientas de análisis web como Google Analytics y Content Square e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estratégicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compañía.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversión online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversión.


Eficiencia operativa


Analizar oportunidades para mejorar la eficiencia del equipo de Atención al Cliente, dando soporte al Team Leader, a partir de los datos de las interacciones con clientes.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a mejorar los resultados y la contribución de los agentes.
Crear dashboards de monitoreo y análisis de desempeño con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.


Otras áreas


Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compañía para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores prácticas.
Dar soporte a la Head of Online Sales & Marketing en iniciativas y proyectos estratégicos, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales online, o la definición de modelos de atribución.


¿Qué buscamos?

Serías ideal para el equipo si cumples estos requisitos:


Al menos 3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos.
Buena experiencia en la creación de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulación y extracción de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
Buenas habilidades de visión de negocio.
Habilidades analíticas y experiencia en la creación de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
Grado universitario en campos afines al análisis de datos (Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Informática, ADE o Economía).
Nivel de inglés medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.


Sería fantástico si...

Además de los requisitos básicos, evaluaremos con atención las siguientes características:


Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
Buenas habilidades interpersonales y de negociación, resolución de problemas, determinación.
Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
Iniciativa y proactividad.
Experiencia con otras diferentes herramientas tecnológicas.


Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambición. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusión en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminación por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religión, orientación sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, información genética, embarazo u otras características personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislación nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, únete a nosotros en el fast lane.

Title: Junior Consultant BI
Description:
¿Te imaginas participando en la transformación de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales?

En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti.

¿Cuál es el reto?

Nuestra práctica tecnológica, se enfoca en ayudar a nuestros clientes en la optimización de sus procesos de negocio e incrementar la eficiencia de su organización (ERP), impulsar una relación efectiva con sus clientes (CRM) y visualizar datos de su organización desde un prisma más ágil e intuitivo (BI) y transformar la eficiencia operativa de las compañías mediante la automatización de tareas y procesos en su área de Robotic Cognitive Automation (RCA). Por ello, somos líderes en proyectos de implantación de soluciones tecnológicas como Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (anteriormente Microsoft Dynamics NAV o Navision), Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM, Power Platform, QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau y Robotics.

¿Cómo te imaginamos?

En estos momentos buscamos profesionales Graduados/as en Ingenierías, Matemáticas, Física o en ADE, Economía, Empresa y Tecnología o carreras afines con inquietudes tecnológicas para incorporarse en nuestro equipo de BI en las oficinas de Barcelona. No es necesaria experiencia previa, uniéndote a nuestro equipo te acompañaremos en tu proceso de aprendizaje, con profesionales que te ayudarán en tu evolución y proyección profesional.

¿Cómo es trabajar en Deloitte?

🤩 Proyectos de alto impacto donde tendrás un largo recorrido y aprendizaje

☯️ Un día a día híbrido-flexible: tendrás horario flexible y un buen equilibrio entre el teletrabajo y el trabajo en equipo en nuestras oficinas o las de nuestros clientes

⚽ Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutarás de varios teambuildings al año, actividades culturales y deportivas… ¡y mucho más!

🧘‍♀️ Bienestar integral: cuídate con nuestro programa de salud física, mental y financiera… ¡y con equipo médico en las oficinas!

🤲 Impacto social: Podrás apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes más lo necesitan

🗣️ Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecerás en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formación impulsarán tu desarrollo. ¿Ya te visualizas en la Deloitte University de París?

🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:


Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil
Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor


¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.
