Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).
Show more

  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
  • Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.


What can make you stand out:


  • Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
  • Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
  • Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
  • Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.


Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)


  • Hybrid Work Model
  • Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
  • Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
  • Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
  • Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
  • Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
  • 5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
  • Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
  • Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
  • Life Insurance with AXA.
  • Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
  • Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
  • Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
  • Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
  • Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).

Title: Analista de Datos & BI
Description:
En esta posición, participarás en un equipo innovador donde cada análisis y modelo de datos contribuirá directamente a la toma de decisiones estratégicas. Trabajarás con herramientas punteras, creando informes y cuadros de mando que facilitarán la visualización y explotación de los datos.







💡 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

✅ Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.

✅ Formación continua para impulsar tu desarrollo profesional.

✅ Flexibilidad horaria y teletrabajo para una mejor conciliación.

✅ Posibilidad de trabajar de forma híbrida en nuestras sedes de Gran Canaria, Tenerife o Madrid, o de forma remota si tu residencia es diferente.







💡 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

🔹 Definirás y desarrollarás modelos de datos, informes y cuadros de mando para proporcionar información clave a los negocios.

🔹 Analizarás los requerimientos de los usuarios de negocio, asegurando que el reporting y la analítica de datos respondan a sus necesidades.

🔹 Construirás ETLs para cargar información al DWH del grupo, facilitando el acceso a los datos mediante herramientas de visualización.

🔹 Mantendrás y evolucionarás los modelos de datos, permitiendo el autoconsumo por parte de los usuarios de negocio.

🔹 Monitorizarás y diagnosticarás posibles incidencias en la actualización y consulta de la información disponible.

🔹 Darás soporte a los usuarios para que comprendan y utilicen correctamente los datos.

🔹 Garantizarás la seguridad, ejecutando de manera rigurosa y eficiente las medidas necesarias para la protección de la información.







✔️ Requisitos imprescindibles:

✅ Formación universitaria en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ingeniería Industrial o similar.

✅ Experiencia de 1 a 3 años en un puesto similar.

✅ Nivel de inglés suficiente para desenvolverte en un entorno profesional.







✨ Además, valoramos positivamente si cuentas con:

🔹 Conocimientos en lenguajes propios del BI y Big Data: SQL y DAX.

🔹 Conocimientos en estadística, algoritmos, análisis de datos y tecnologías de almacenamiento e integración de datos.

🔹 Experiencia en analítica avanzada y aprendizaje automático con tecnologías Big Data.

🔹 Manejo de otros lenguajes como Python, PySpark o lenguaje M (Power Query).

🔹 Uso de herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.

🔹 Familiaridad con ecosistemas y metodologías como Azure, Databricks, DevOps, GIT o Power Platform (Power Automate y Power Apps).

🔹 Conocimientos en protección de datos y seguridad de la información.







Buscamos a alguien con mentalidad analítica, iniciativa y pasión por la transformación digital. Si cumples con el perfil y quieres crecer en un entorno dinámico, ¡queremos conocerte!




🚀 Si te apasionan los datos y quieres impulsar tu carrera en un entorno dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!




Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

Title: Data Analyst - Visualización & Negocio (Barcelona)
Description:
Únete a nosotros y forma parte del futuro de BCNC Group🚀




Somos una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología con operaciones en España, Reino Unido, Alemania, Francia y Suecia. Trabajamos con las multinacionales más prestigiosas de Europa ayudándoles a implementar sus proyectos estratégicos. #WeHaveOurOwnCode




🔍Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en visualización de datos con enfoque en la generación de valor a negocio a través del análisis de datos trabajando codo a codo con las áreas estratégicas en una empresa referente del sector servicios con gran volumen de usuarios.




✨Qué harás en tu día a día:

Diseñar y construir dashboards claros, visuales y útiles que apoyen la toma de decisiones.
Generar storytelling con datos, facilitando la interpretación de la información para las áreas de negocio.
Colaborar de forma estrecha con el Product Owner y con los equipos comerciales y de operaciones, entendiendo sus procesos y retos.
Proponer mejoras y accionables a partir de los datos disponibles.
Promover buenas prácticas en el uso y consumo de la información, con mirada crítica y enfoque en la mejora continua.




✨Qué aspectos claves esperamos de ti:

Experiencia de al menos 3 años como analista de datos en proyectos recientes.
Dominio de herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Colaboración estrecha con equipos de negocio para comprender necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones visuales. Se valora capacidad analítica, sentido visual y orientación a la claridad en los datos.
Proactividad y orientación al impacto: no buscamos solo alguien que entregue dashboards, sino que aporte valor desde el análisis.
Trabajo en entornos ágiles (Scrum) y equipos multidisciplinares.




✨Que tenemos para ti:

🤝Contrato indefinido en una compañía de tecnología e ingeniería 100% digital.

👩‍💻Híbrido: 3 días de teletrabajo y 2 día a la semana en oficina.

⌚Flexibilidad real: Un horario flexible de entrada/salida para que seas tu quien gestione su tiempo de la manera más óptima.

✨Innovación: Proyectos retadores con tecnologías de vanguardia.

📖Formación: Un programa de formación personalizado y alineado en lo que más te apasione. Acceso a distintas plataformas educativas: Udemy, Openwebinars, entre otras que surjan a partir de tus necesidades e intereses.

🤩Desarrollo profesional: Un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de BCNC Group.

🌴Vacaciones: contarás con 23 días laborables de vacaciones + 2 días (24 y 31 de diciembre por convenio) y porque no todo es trabajo, todos los viernes del año y verano (julio y agosto) de jornada intensiva.

🙌🏻Plan de referidos: Si, tus recomendaciones cuentan y cada vez que se incorpore a BCNC Group una persona que referencies recibirás una compensación económica por ello.




Y sobre todo… un buen entorno laboral: nuestros colaboradores puntúan un 4.7 sobre 5 su experiencia en BCNC Group!




Te queremos conocer...

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Para algunas personas, la tecnología es reto, la innovación es pasión, y la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo es una oportunidad.




Somos una consultora tecnológica que ofrece soluciones globales a las necesidades complejas de las empresas desde otro punto de vista. Escuchamos para crear progreso en nuestro mundo, integrando tecnología y conocimiento.




Si estás buscando nuevos retos, buscamos incorporar a nuestro equipo un perfil de Analista de Datos.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento.
Desarrollo de procesos de extracción, transformación y carga (procesos ETL) y modelado y estructura de datos.
Definición de arquitectura y selección del ecosistema/plataforma de gestión del dato.
Generar soluciones Business Intelligence, gestionando BBDD transaccionales y programación en SQL.
Generar cuadros de mando con Power BI.




¿Qué buscamos?

Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Telecomunicaciones o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en funciones similares.




¿Qué podemos aportarte?

Contrato Indefinido. Creemos en el desarrollo a largo plazo de nuestros empleados, por eso ofrecemos estabilidad laboral desde el primer día.
Flexibilidad horaria y conciliación. Fomentamos un entorno de trabajo flexible para que puedas equilibrar tu vida personal y profesional. Además, tenemos jornada intensiva los viernes y durante los meses de verano.
Plan de carrera individualizado. Diseñamos un plan de desarrollo profesional para que puedas alcanzar tus metas y crecer dentro de la empresa.
Programa de retribución flexible (Plan de pensiones, seguro de salud, plataforma beneficios....).




Si has llegado hasta aquí... ¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).

  • Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
  • 5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
  • Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
  • Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
  • Life Insurance with AXA.
  • Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
  • Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
  • Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
  • Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
  • Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).

Title: Analista de datos

¡Estamos buscando un Experto en Data & BI! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Sobre nosotros:




En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.




El rol:




Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst (con enfoque en Operaciones y Ventas) para unirse a nuestro equipo y liderar iniciativas clave en análisis avanzado, forecasting y visualización de datos.

Tu trabajo será fundamental para guiar decisiones estratégicas en operaciones y ventas, mediante el diseño de modelos predictivos, reporting inteligente y análisis profundo de datos.




¿Cuál será tu misión?




Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de aprendizaje automático enfocados en eficiencia operativa y predicción de ventas.
Explorar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos, garantizando su calidad e integridad.
Crear dashboards interactivos y visualizaciones impactantes que ayuden a los equipos de operaciones y ventas a entender los datos y tomar mejores decisiones.
Colaborar de forma transversal con equipos de producto, ingeniería, operaciones y ventas para entender sus retos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como regresión, pruebas de hipótesis o análisis de series temporales para prever tendencias y mejorar procesos.
Diseñar y analizar experimentos A/B para validar hipótesis y optimizar resultados.
Trabajar con herramientas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) y tecnologías de Big Data para desarrollar soluciones escalables y eficientes.
Contribuir al desarrollo de una cultura de datos sólida, participando en la definición de políticas de gobernanza y buenas prácticas.




Lo que te hará triunfar:




+2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, análisis o machine learning, preferiblemente aplicados a operaciones y ventas.
Dominio de Python o R, junto con bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.
Conocimiento sólido en SQL y experiencia consultando bases de datos complejas.
Experiencia utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib.
Familiaridad con plataformas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Habilidad para traducir resultados técnicos en mensajes claros y accionables para stakeholders no técnicos.
Mentalidad proactiva, enfoque en la colaboración y pasión por resolver problemas complejos.




Beneficios:

🕑Flexibilidad horaria
💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
🏠Formato Híbrido/ Remoto
😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
📅Agosto flexible
🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
🤩Referral Program
🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
🍎Fruta en oficina

Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Power Platform
Description:
🚀¿Te interesa el mundo del dato, la automatización y las herramientas low-code? ¡Tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti!.




Desde Adecco, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil Junior Data Analyst con foco en Power Platform para incorporar en un entorno internacional, innovador y con proyectos punteros de visualización y automatización.




🎁 ¿Qué se ofrece?




💼 Contratación directa e indefinida por cliente final.

🏢Modelo híbrido.

📍Ubicación en Málaga.

🌍 Entorno internacional, dinámico y en crecimiento.




💡 ¿Qué harás en este rol?




🔹 Participarás en la automatización de procesos y recogida de requisitos de negocio.

🔹 Desarrollarás dashboards, KPIs y modelos de datos (estrella, copo de nieve).

🔹 Crearás flujos en Power Automate y aplicaciones con Power Apps.

🔹 Modelarás y transformarás datos para facilitar su explotación en Power BI.

🔹 Colaborarás en la definición de roles de acceso y seguridad en visualizaciones.




🎯 Requisitos clave:




✅ Grado o titulación técnica relacionada con Tecnología o Informática.

✅ Conocimiento en Power BI, Power Apps y Power Automate.

✅ Experiencia (académica o práctica) con modelos de datos relacionales.

✅ Metodologías Agile (Jira, Confluence, DevOps).

✅ Español fluido (C1) e inglés intermedio (B2).




🌟 Será un plus si cuentas con:




🔹 Conocimientos en Location Intelligence, Data Governance y visualización avanzada (D3.js, JS).

🔹 Experiencia en pipelines CI/CD (Jenkins) y gestión de calidad del dato.




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres un nuevo reto, ¡inscríbete ahora! 📩

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🔍 Empower Data, Drive Insight, and Elevate Decision-Making – Right from Madrid! 🇪🇸




Are you someone who gets excited about turning raw data into real impact? 📊 At FERO, we're on the lookout for a Junior Data Analyst who's eager to dig deep into data, support internal reporting, investigate issues, and bring clarity to complex questions across teams—from ops and product to sales and customer success. You’ll be a key player in driving data excellence, supporting strategic decisions, and helping us grow smarter, faster. 🚀




Who We Are

We're FERO, a high-growth startup reinventing the checkout and payment experience 💳 to help our customers increase conversions and revenue. Backed by top-tier VCs, we’re building our future from the heart of Madrid, combining cutting-edge tech 🖥️ with a collaborative, data-driven culture.




We offer:




💰 Competitive pay

🩻 Half sponsored Private Health Insurance

✨ The chance to make a real difference in an environment that values curiosity, creativity, and impact




What You'll Do




🔎 Investigate and Analyse: Support incident investigations and root-cause analyses with data insights and exploratory analysis.

🤝 Enable Sales & Success Teams: Help prepare data-driven materials and insights for customer proof-of-concepts and strategic conversations.

🧹 Push Data Quality: Help monitor data pipelines, identify inconsistencies, and contribute to cleaner, more reliable datasets.

📊 Internal Reporting & Dashboards: Help design and maintain reports that provide clear visibility into key business metrics.

🔗 Work Cross-Functionally: Collaborate with engineering, product, and business stakeholders to answer critical questions and support decision-making.

📚 Build Data Culture: Help foster data literacy and support the adoption of better data practices throughout the company.




What We Offer




🧠 Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge solutions in a greenfield setting.

🌱 Growth Opportunities: Join us early and grow with us professionally and personally.

🤗 Collaborative Culture: Be part of a friendly, creative, and supportive team.

🏠 Flexible Work: Hybrid model - 3 days in office, 2 days WFH.

💼 Competitive Compensation: Great pay, employee equity, and private health insurance partially sponsored by FERO.

Who You Are

🧐 Analytically Curious: You love exploring messy datasets, spotting patterns, and figuring out what the data really says.

🐍 Python Fluent: Comfortable using Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) for data cleaning, analysis, and basic visualisations.

🗣️ Clear Communicator: Able to present findings in a structured, simple, and actionable way - both in writing and in conversation.

🔍 Detail-Oriented: You have an eye for accuracy and consistency when working with data.

🤝 Collaborative & Proactive: You enjoy working in a team and aren’t afraid to ask questions or speak up with ideas.

🚀 Eager to Grow: You’re hungry to learn and ready to grow in both technical and business dimensions.

✅ Eligible to Work in Spain




Ready to Join Us?

Excited to make a difference? 💥 Send us your English CV and let's get started on this amazing journey together! 🎉

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst to join our dynamic team.

The ideal candidate will conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis across various projects to optimise company growth and business. You will manipulate datasets, create financial models, and summarise findings in a succinct manner for client's usage.




Responsibilities




Compile data into actionable reports
Prepare pitch and presentation materials
Work collaboratively with team members
Think strategically about improving company operations




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Business or Economics or related discipline 1 - 3 years of experience working with data in a related field
Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Ability to work with people from many different cultural backgrounds.
Autonomous and organised
Ability to deal effectively with pressure
Be an organised thinker who can create order from complex situation
Fluency in English




If you are a dedicated MDM professional with a passion for data integrity and compliance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help us achieve excellence in master data management.




-------

WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

WPP es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y considera a todos los candidatos para cualquier puesto sin discriminación ni distinción por características particulares. Estamos comprometidos con fomentar una cultura de respeto en la que todas las personas se sientan parte y tengan las mismas oportunidades de desarrollo profesional

  • Fluency in English


If you are a dedicated MDM professional with a passion for data integrity and compliance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help us achieve excellence in master data management.


-------

WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

WPP es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y considera a todos los candidatos para cualquier puesto sin discriminación ni distinción por características particulares. Estamos comprometidos con fomentar una cultura de respeto en la que todas las personas se sientan parte y tengan las mismas oportunidades de desarrollo profesional

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!




Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team’s efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.




You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you’ll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.




You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.




To be successful in the role you must bring:

At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
Emotional resilience: You can give and take criticism well. You don’t get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you’re polite enough to challenge others’ ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don’t know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Show more

What do we offer?

  • Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
  • Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Extia, where people come first! Since 2007, we’ve combined performance with well-being at work — and it shows: #1 Great Place to Work® in France (2024-25) and among the Best Workplaces in Europe for 7 years running..




At Extia, it’s “First who, then what.” So, let’s move forward together!




Estamos en búsqueda de un/a Data Analyst para colaborar en un proyecto de desarrollo de dashboards de calidad de servicio (QoS), enfocados en el seguimiento del rendimiento de aplicaciones, eventos de logs y KPIs de negocio.

El objetivo del puesto es transformar datos en insights accionables mediante el uso de herramientas avanzadas de visualización, modelado y análisis.




📍 Ubicación: Madrid

📅 Incorporación: Inmediata




Responsabilidades:

1. Recogida de necesidades & Coordinación

Entender las necesidades funcionales del negocio.
Colaborar con equipos técnicos (integración de datos y Data Lake) para asegurar la correcta disponibilidad de los datos.




2. Análisis & Visualización

Modelado y transformación de datos con Power BI y DAX.
Diseño y mantenimiento de dashboards interactivos e intuitivos.
Aplicación de cálculos, filtros y reglas de negocio según los requisitos funcionales.




3. Entregables esperados

Modelos de datos claros y estructurados para facilitar el análisis.
Dashboards de Power BI conectados a cubos de datos en Azure Analysis Services.
Documentación funcional y técnica de los análisis realizados.




Perfil buscado:

Experiencia mínima: 2 años como Data Analyst o en un rol similar.

Herramientas requeridas:

Dominio de Power BI y DAX.
Conocimiento práctico de Azure Analysis Services y nociones de Databricks son altamente valoradas.
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y orientación a resultados.
Se valoran perfiles intermedios, avanzados o expertos.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Proyecto con fuerte componente de análisis de datos y visualización.
Uso de tecnologías modernas y trabajo con grandes volúmenes de datos.
Colaboración en un entorno dinámico con enfoque en la mejora continua.




¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV directamente a través de LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Your mission

As a Data Analyst Intern at Livo, you will work closely with Product and Business teams, your responsibilities will be:


Conduct analyses on customer usage, engagement, and feature effectiveness
Build dashboards and reports to monitor product performance and user behavior
Define and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for Product and Business initiatives
Present findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Your profile


Currently finishing a degree in Data, Computer Science or a related field
Proactive mindset with a strong eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g. Metabase, Tableau, Looker Studio, etc.)
Comfortable communicating data-driven insights clearly and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Bonus points for experience with Product or Web Analytics tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, PostHog, etc.)


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.

Why us?

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando 1 perfil de Data Analyst Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis Spain donde llevamos a cabo importantes proyectos de Inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura con clientes nacionales e internacionales, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




REQUISITOS TÉCNICOS

Experiencia demostrable en el uso de Power BI para la creación de informes y dashboards.
Conocimientos sólidos en modelado de datos y lenguaje DAX.
Familiaridad con bases de datos relacionales y consultas en SQL.
Capacidad para analizar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer insights relevantes.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación.
Valorable contar con certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.
Valorable contar con experiencia en herramientas de ETL y procesos de integración de datos.
Valorable contar con conocimientos en otras herramientas de visualización de datos.




RESPONSABILIDADES

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para comprender los requisitos de negocio y traducirlos en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Optimizar modelos de datos y consultas para mejorar el rendimiento de los informes.
Garantizar la calidad y precisión de los datos presentados en los dashboards.
Proporcionar soporte y formación a usuarios finales sobre el uso de Power BI.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto desde cualquier punto de España.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Talavera de la Reina, Castile-La Mancha, Spain
Description:
¡Hola! 🙋




¿Todavía no conoces HIBERUS TECNOLOGÍA? Somos una empresa de #tecnología construida con un ingrediente diferencial, la HIPERESPECIALIZACIÓN.




Formar parte de Hiberus significa crecimiento, pasión por la tecnología, interés por la innovación, ambiente laboral flexible y colaborativo, compañerismo, aprendizaje, formación continua, motivación y superación ante nuevos retos...y esto es solo el principio.

Somos más de 3.000 profesionales y no paramos de crecer!🙌

Actualmente contamos con más de 36 hubs de desarrollo en España, EEUU, Reino Unido, Alemania, Rumanía, Italia, Andorra, Marruecos, Argentina, México, Ecuador y Colombia ¡Estamos redefiniendo el mapa tecnológico mundial! 🌐 💻




Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!




🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en Oracle (OAS, OAC, OBIEE). Buscamos una persona que nos ayude a seguir creciendo, con ganas de aportar y seguir evolucionando de la mano de los mejores profesionales, pero sobre todo... ¡en Hiberus buscamos buena gente! 😉




💻Algunas de tus funciones

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes interactivos utilizando Oracle Analytics Server (OAS), Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) y OBIEE.
Interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y transformarlos en insights accionables para los equipos de negocio.
Participar en la recolección y análisis de requerimientos para construir soluciones de reporting personalizadas.




🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos?

💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento.

💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación

🏠 Acuerdos de teletrabajo

🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia!

⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, acuerdos de teletrabajo, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano.

🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades!

📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes.

💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc.




En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo.

Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos!

Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos.







Hablamos?




www.hiberus.com




#somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀

Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!


🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en Oracle (OAS, OAC, OBIEE). Buscamos una persona que nos ayude a seguir creciendo, con ganas de aportar y seguir evolucionando de la mano de los mejores profesionales, pero sobre todo... ¡en Hiberus buscamos buena gente! 😉


💻Algunas de tus funciones

  • Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes interactivos utilizando Oracle Analytics Server (OAS), Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) y OBIEE.
  • Interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y transformarlos en insights accionables para los equipos de negocio.
  • Participar en la recolección y análisis de requerimientos para construir soluciones de reporting personalizadas.


🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos?

💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento.

💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación

🏠 Acuerdos de teletrabajo

🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia!

⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, acuerdos de teletrabajo, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano.

🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades!

📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes.

💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc.


En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo.

Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos!

Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos.



Hablamos?


www.hiberus.com


#somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀

Title: Junior Big Data & Data Analytics
Description:
Elegir Capgemini es elegir la posibilidad de dar forma a tu carrera profesional como desees. Recibirás el apoyo y la inspiración de una comunidad colaborativa de colegas de todo el mundo y podrás reinventar lo que es posible. Únete a nuestro equipo y ayuda a las principales organizaciones del mundo a descubrir el valor de la tecnología y a construir un mundo más sostenible e inclusivo.




¿Te apetece sumarte a nosotros y participar en proyectos multisectoriales en el equipo de I&D conformado por profesionales del dato como Data Scientists, Data Engineers o Data Analysts? Nuestro objetivo es ayudar a nuestros clientes en el camino hacia la innovación continua.




¿Qué harás en el proyecto? ¿Cuál será tu rol?




Vamos a orientarte, según tu perfil profesional, hacia el área en la que puedas desarrollarte acorde con tu conocimiento, competencias y habilidades.

Recibirás formación inicial y te integrarás en un equipo de profesionales colaborando en proyectos relacionados con tu formación.




Conocerás nuestras diversas comunidades profesionales:




Hyperscaler /Enterprise (Big Data)
Analytics & Gen AI
Data Story Telling
SAP BI
Data Trust




Si has finalizado uno de estos Grados:




Grado en Ingeniería Informática,
Grado en Ciencia de Datos
Grado en Matemáticas
Grado en Física
Grado Superior en Desarrollo de Aplicaciones Multiplataforma (DAM)
Grado Superior en Desarrollo de Aplicaciones Informáticas (DAI)




O si estás estudiando Máster o Posgrado relacionado con Big Data también te esperamos.




Además, sería genial si tuvieses los siguientes conocimientos:




BBDD: SQL, MySQL
Lenguajes de Programación Multiparadigma Python, Scala.
Programación Orientada a Objetos, como Java o C++
Nivel de inglés fluido (mínimo B2).




Nos sorprenderás agradablemente si también hubieses tenido conocimiento de:




Spark o Pyspark
Machine Learning
Deep Learning.




Se valorará positivamente el poseer certificado de discapacidad, en el marco de nuestra política de inclusión y diversidad.




Valoraremos todas las candidaturas. Contamos con una amplísima oferta formativa, presencial, online de Certificaciones, etc. Aunque no tengas el 100% de los conocimientos valorados ¡nos encantará conocerte!




Nuestro compromiso con la inclusión e igualdad de oportunidades hace que tengamos un Plan de Igualdad y un Código Ético que garantizan el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección dentro de un entorno libre de discriminación por cuestión de etnia, nacionalidad, origen social, edad, orientación sexual, expresión de género, religión o cualquier otra circunstancia personal, física o social.




¿Qué te gustará de trabajar aquí?




Tenemos un catálogo de medidas de Desarrollo y Conciliación muy completo, como son, por ejemplo:

• Un ambiente de trabajo único muy valorado por nuestros profesionales en las evaluaciones periódicas.

• Wellbeing HUB - Incluye políticas y acciones para la salud física (Wellhub) y mental.

• 24 días de vacaciones + 2 asuntos propios + 24 y 31 de diciembre + opción a comprar hasta 7 días de vacaciones al año.

• FlexAbroad: posibilidad de trabajar en remoto desde otro país durante 45 días.

• Plan de Compensación Flexible (seguro médico, transporte, formación, tarjeta restaurante o subvención de comida, guardería…)

• Formación continua, podrás disfrutar de Mylearning y de Capgemini University y de nuestros Campus Digitales y Comunidades profesionales. Tendrás acceso a plataformas como: Coursera, Udemy, Pluralsight, Harvard Manager Mentor, Education First para idiomas (inglés francés, alemán…) ¡entre otras!

• Participación en Acciones de Voluntariado y Acción Social con nuestros Grupos de Sostenibilidad, Inclusión e Igualdad.

• Acompañamiento en tus inicios con el programa de Buddies.

• Seguro de Vida y Accidentes




¿Por qué Capgemini?




Capgemini es líder global en transformando los negocios de los clientes aprovechando todo el poder de la tecnología. Nos guía el propósito de lograr un futuro inclusivo y sostenible a través de la tecnología y de la energía de quienes la desarrollamos. Somos una compañía responsable y diversa, líder internacional en servicios de IT e Ingeniería con más de 360.000 profesionales en más de 50 países. Con una sólida herencia de 55 años y una amplia experiencia en la industria, los clientes confían en Capgemini para abordar la totalidad de sus necesidades comerciales, desde la estrategia y el diseño hasta las operaciones, impulsadas por el rápido y novedoso mundo de la nube, los datos, la IA, la conectividad, el software, las plataformas e ingeniería digitales. El Grupo reportó en 2022 ingresos globales de €22 mil millones.




Reescribe tu futuro. ¡Únete al equipo!




www.capgemini.com/es-es

Title: Analyst, Advanced Data & Insights
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

The Global Business Optimisation (GBO) team mission, as part of the Client Services (CS) organization, is to turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value while working closely with Visa’s stakeholders to build creative solutions. Our Advance Data Analytics and Insights analysts are experts in data, coding, payment processing (including authorization and authentication), and creative thinking. We couple in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa’s world-class products to address meaningful business problems.

In this role the analyst interprets and manage data to solve complex problems utilizing skills in data extraction, pre-processing, cleaning, visualization, and the use of tools like python, and Tableau. They are actively involved with all other teams in CS, supporting and developing new insights that help create, manage, and deliver actionable insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

Specific activities may include:


Data extraction: using your payment knowledge you will be responsible for extracting the correct data from numerous databases.
Data cleaning: perform data preprocessing, including cleaning and transforming data into usable information.
Data analysis: apply payments knowledge to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Data validation: validate data extracted by you and others in the team to control data quality/ reliability.
Data visualization: develop visualizations to make complex analyses accessible to a broad audience.
Provide analytical and support about platforms, tools and data to internal stakeholders including delivering SME training.
Maintain highly strategic reports.
Work with a pan-European team and contribute to local and global projects across Visa.
Work in a Big Data environment with its technical challenges.
Be an out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming and implementing innovative ways to use our unique data to answer business problems.
Keen interest in working with a team of expert’s data analysts to create Advance Analytics, e.g.: training and deploying Machine Learning models, developing statistical analysis, etc.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

Qualifications

A genuine passion for data, and about the payment’s ecosystem.

Intermediate to advance level skills in using data analysis tools and software. Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau.

Proficient in all MS Office applications.

Confidence working in a high pace and dynamic environment, following several

work streams at the same time.

Experience in a corporate environment with data-based decision-making or quantitative analysis.

Ability to turn complex data subjects into easily understandable concepts.

Desirable

Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills (fluency in English is required while knowledge of an additional European language is a plus).

Experience of creating business value from data.

Knowledge of authorisation and/ or authentication processing.

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde SII Group Spain buscamos un/a Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de TI.




¿Quieres embarcarte en nuevos proyectos 🚀?

¡Sin duda querrás conocer más sobre esta oportunidad! 😁




¿Por qué trabajar aquí?




👉FORMACIÓN PERSONALIZADA: Dispondrás de acceso a nuestras plataformas técnicas Pluralsight & OpenWebinars y Open Sessions que te permitirán mejorar tus soft skills con cursos de Mindfulness, coaching...

👉MODELO DE TRABAJO HÍBRIDO: 1 día oficina.

👉PAQUETE DE RETRIBUCIÓN FLEXIBLE: Te cuidamos y ponemos a tu disposición beneficios sociales (seguro médico privado, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería o ticket transporte).

👉SOMOS UNA FAMILIA: Cuidamos de esta gran familia organizando afterworks, cenas y eventos 🍻.




Requisitos:




Conocimientos en análisis de datos (estadísticas e inferencia) para diseño de indicadores de procesos.
Conocimientos/habilidades en la definición, análisis y optimización de procesos.
Conocimientos/habilidades/experiencia en la elaboración de materiales formativos y de comunicación.
Conocimiento de metodologías de gestión de proyectos (PMO, agile, etc.)
Titulación universitaria, nivel licenciatura o máster, en el ámbito de la informática, las telecomunicaciones o en administración y dirección de empresas.
Titulación a nivel de máster valorable.




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos una multinacional francesa que ofrece servicios y soluciones IT en todo el mundo, con presencia en 21 países, por lo que podrás disfrutar de movilidad geográfica si quieres vivir una experiencia internacional, así como participar en proyectos internacionales de gran envergadura, como en este caso.




💙¡SOMOS UN EXCELENTE LUGAR DE TRABAJO! Certificados por Great Place to Work.💙

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

  • Understanding our business and its processes through our data
  • Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
  • Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
  • Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
  • Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
  • Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need

  • Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
  • A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
  • 5+ years of experience with SQL
  • Great skills with Python or other programming languages
  • Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

  • Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
  • Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst BI
Description:
¿Eres Data Analyst BI y estás buscando un nuevo reto profesional?




En Claire Joster Technology seguimos creciendo junto a nuestros clientes, y en esta ocasión buscamos incorporar a un/a Data Analyst BI para una compañía líder en el sector de la producción con sede en Barcelona y presencia internacional.




Buscamos a alguien con experiencia sólida en desarrollo de Power BI, SQL avanzado y visión proactiva en la mejora continua de procesos IT.




¿Qué harás?




📊 Migrar y desarrollar informes en Power BI
🧠 Crear dashboards e informes interactivos conectados a SQL
🛠️ Dar soporte tecnológico transversal (ofimática, equipos, telefonía móvil)
🚀 Proponer e implementar mejoras tecnológicas




¿Qué buscamos?




Una persona autónoma, resolutiva, con ganas de aportar y que no necesite supervisión diaria.




Presencialidad 100% en las oficinas de Barcelona, en un entorno dinámico, colaborativo y con alto componente técnico.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Un proyecto estable, entorno tecnológico puntero y oportunidades reales de crecimiento profesional dentro de una empresa sólida y en expansión.




Si crees que este reto encaja contigo o conoces a alguien que pueda estar interesado/a inscríbete en la oferta.
