Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Número da Solicitação de Emprego: 88937

Horário: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Data analysis – understand and document the usage of data in the values of the received data formats.
Technical analysis of different data formats received from different data sources.
Use documentation and examples related to data interfaces to understand data structure and provide translation specifications (mappings) from one data format to another.
Identify and document gaps between producing and consuming applications and the Enterprise Data Models based on translation specifications (mappings)
Development and maintenance of documentation
Technical and non-technical stakeholder management (incl. information architects, business change managers, data product owners, data engineers, product owners and tech leads)
Ensure version control and governance around workflow management is followed.
Continuously seek and suggest improvements/optimisations to the process



Our requirements:



Bachelor’s degree in a relevant subject
At least 3 years’ experience working in similar role.
Knowledge of TMS systems and data attribute analysis and mapping is advantages
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
Being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to talk and present to a range of audiences, facilitating interactions to gain insight into open questions
The ability to work under pressure delivering on agreed deadlines
A good understanding of information technology
Excellent level of written and spoken English

Title: Product Analyst, Chat
Description:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Lisbon

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities


Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Business - Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Run requirements workshops.
Create structured user stories for developers to be able to work on moving data from source to destination systems.


Qualifications


At least 4 years' experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst;
Proven experience in Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and data migration projects;
Good knowledge of Oracle;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply


The candidate must be resident in Portugal.

Title: Product Analyst, Chat
Description:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities


Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day


As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Ensure high quality of delivery
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Create/Update some dashboards
Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team based in Lisbon and Porto. Our working language is English, and we offer a hybrid work model
You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has three mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges
The team is young, agile, and everyone is growing together. More than 20 colleagues are working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences, and you will be able to share your insights with the central teams in Paris
We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?

Do you have…


A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field?
At least 3 years of relevant experience
Strong programming skills in Python?
Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
Fluency in oral and written English.
Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau Software)
Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
Availability for occasional travel in Europe


If you bring all this, a lot of desire, energy and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for...

We look forward to receiving your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst – Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.
Show more

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Senior (M/W)
Description:
Company Description

VANTIVA, headquartered in Paris, France and formerly known as Technicolor, is a global technology leader in designing, developing and supplying innovative products and solutions that connect consumers around the world to the content and services they love – whether at home, at work or in other smart spaces.

VANTIVA has also earned a solid reputation for optimizing supply chain performance by leveraging its decades-long expertise in high-precision manufacturing, logistics, fulfilment and distribution. With operations throughout the Americas, Asia Pacific and EMEA, VANTIVA is recognized as a strategic partner by leading firms across various vertical industries, including network service providers, software companies and video game creators for over 25 years.

Our relationships with the film and entertainment industry goes back over 100 years by providing end-to-end solutions for our clients. VANTIVA is committed to the highest standards of corporate social responsibility and sustainability across all aspects of their operations.

For more information, please visit www.vantiva.com

Job Description

The BI expert will contribute to all aspects of BI development, covering Vantiva applications and supporting the implementation of the data strategy roadmap.

This role is critical in designing, developing, and maintaining data warehousing, reporting solutions, and BI applications. It requires a strong foundation in business intelligence, analytics, and functional expertise to interpret business requirements effectively.

The candidate will drive solution design, customization, and development to resolve issues, enhance existing solutions, and deliver new business intelligence capabilities.

The ideal candidate thrives in complex technical environments, enjoys problem-solving, and is passionate about data and analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Align and implement data architecture to support data analytics, reporting needs, and business planning requirements.
Ensure BI system health and performance by proposing, implementing, and monitoring best practices.
Maintain data reliability across all layers of the data platform and satellite systems.
Develop best practices for data visualization, dashboarding, planning, analytics, and application architecture.
Conduct root cause analysis and provide recommendations to leadership to mitigate risks and improve efficiency.
Ensure compliance with core solution principles and industry regulations for data handling and reporting.
Implement and maintain data security measures to protect sensitive information.
Handle user support requests, prioritizing them based on business impact.
Perform necessary system configurations and developments as needed.
Collaborate extensively with business stakeholders to understand reporting & analytics needs and deliver solutions that meet their requirements.


Qualifications


Highly motivated, proactive, and a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Strong experience in analyzing, diagnosing, designing, planning, executing, and evaluating BI solutions while meeting time, cost, and quality targets.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and documentation skills.
10+ years of experience in data foundation, data management, data governance, and insights generation.
Senior-level expertise in SAP BI architecture and development tools, with a focus on BW/4HANA.
Hands-on experience with BW/4HANA, IP/BPC, SAC, BODS, BOBJ (Webi), and Analysis for Excel.
Exposure to HANA administration, including data provisioning, data tiering, security, and performance optimization.
Proficiency in ABAP development is required (programs, functions, object classes, WebDynpro).
Strong SQL skills with experience in query performance tuning.
Knowledge of MS Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and Data Factory is an advantage.
Databricks experience is a strong plus completed by a proficiency in Python.


Additional Information

The position is located in Lisbon, Portugal.

Our most important asset is our People

Vantiva’s success greatly relies on our people’s energy, motivation, and talent.

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.
Show more

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more.

The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate, will play a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving commercial success. You will be responsible for forecasting, producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis, and supporting wider Business Units within the ACCP.

Other responsibilities will include:


Understand business drivers to create, prepare, and maintain patient and demand-based forecasts and scenarios
Contribute to regular forecast cycles including multiple cycles of annual long-range forecast, and short-term forecast
Perform in-depth data analysis to build robust assumptions, scenarios, and forecast inputs
Present and defend forecast approach, methodology, assumptions, and outputs in team discussions
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. The ideal candidate is is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
3+ years working in a finance/data related field ideally Data and Analytics.
Forecasting and Modelling experience
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel knowledge


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of other MS Office applications, SQL, Hyperion Pillar, Tableau, Anaplan).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Clearly explains processes and procedures.
Fluency in multiple European languages.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Title: Data Analyst - Operational and Permanent Control Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The OPC analyst plays a key role in Global Banking CCCO(Chief Conduct and Control Officer) Office Front-to-Ops missions and worldwide mandate to identify and assess non-financial risks, to ensure the enforcement and efficiency of the control framework and to promote an adequate risk management culture. The Analyst contributes to Global Banking CCCO leading the Front-to-Operations to IT alignment for Global Banking across the three regions to strengthen and industrialize GB non-financial risk management set-up, anticipate regulators' expectations and protect the interests of the Bank' stakeholders.

Specifically, the OPC(Operational and Permanent Control) Analyst operates the Control framework relating to all operational risks, including Fraud, Third Party, Conduct, Compliance, Regulatory, Information & Communication Technology risks, and others risks types.

Your Main Activities Are


Performing/driving the risk identification and assessment in liaison with independent control Functions when needed
Ensuring validation by the relevant management level and consistency with the defined risk tolerance.
Contributing to the definition and follow-up of remediation plan if needed
Centralize and automate the production of reports gathering major operational risks indicators via automated KPI/KRI dashboards
Automate, when possible and relevant, sampling creation, control execution, and control reporting across the full value chain
Manage Procedures by ensuring that Group procedures requirements are implemented locally, complemented with local specificities
Ensure that the procedures designed by the businesses and functions are identified, updated, properly stored and communicated to the relevant stakeholders within the Operating Entity
Identify and propose calibration of procedures according to the outcome of the risk assessment and other risk events
Perform and/or coordinate controls according to this control plan
Ensure that control results are reviewed and analyzed by the Management and when relevant by operational teams / relevant stakeholders and that remediation action plans are defined if and when needed
Input in Group tools the control results and major action plans. Follow-up the implementation of remediation actions
Collect incidents, report and update in the incidents database, including suspected and attempted fraud cases
Analyze incidents in a timely manner and define, jointly with the relevant stakeholders, the correctives measures be implemented to mitigate risks
Follow-up and /or initiate the implementation of remediation actions and the unfolding of long-term incidents.
Perform controls on the incident collection process, particularly the cross-check with other databases and the half-yearly attestation by the local management.
Alert and escalate to the relevant level of management any operational risk incident and any recurring weakness.
Perform periodic and ad-hoc reporting to the appropriate level of management as well as to independent control functions
Ensure an appropriate training on Operational risks and Permanent Control framework is provided to employees, notably newcomers
Show ability to take ownership of specific OPC activity streams/topics and be able to deliver the full and exhaustive actions taken on the assigned processes to the management.


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, Finance or any similar areas
Advanced level of english fluency, both oral and written
Up to 2 years of experience in data analytics, operational risk or compliance activities
Experience using Microsoft Office Tools, particularly Excel
Proficiency in Power BI, Python and SQL
Attention to detail and creative thinking


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group's retail activities and specialized business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialized businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit [1] https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


Show more

Title: Customer Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Ready to lead, disrupt and reinvent the sleep industry?

We are Emma – The Sleep Company. Founded in 2015, we’ve become the world’s largest D2C sleep brand, available in over 35 countries with more than 25 stores across Europe. Recommended by leading consumer associations in EMEA, APAC, and the Americas, we develop the best sleep comfort products that empower our customers to awaken their best every day.

At Emma, we are a community of smart, driven people, united by a strong culture of collaboration, teamwork, and knowledge sharing. We think big, take ownership, and are empowered to drive meaningful impact. Through hands-on experience, mentorship, and continuous learning, we drive our own growth and learning. With Emmies from over 60 nationalities and offices across multiple regions, our diverse perspectives enrich our workplace culture. Ready to shape the future of sleep with us? Let’s make it happen!

What You'll Do


Transform Customer Data into Action: Analyze customer journey data to generate actionable insights that improve customer experience (CSAT, NPS, contact rate).
Develop Reporting Solutions: Own the design, development, and maintenance of dashboards and reports for the Customer Excellence team.
Data-Driven Decision Support: Translate customer experience challenges into analytical approaches, identifying opportunities for improvement in processes and support.
Own CX Reporting: Manage the entire reporting process, ensuring consistent, reliable, and timely delivery of insights to stakeholders.
Create Impactful Visualizations: Build intuitive and effective dashboards in Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with Customer Service, Product Tech, and Operations teams to ensure insights align with business goals and improve the overall customer journey.
Improve Data Infrastructure: Contribute to data modeling and the optimization of ETL pipelines specific to Customer Excellence needs.



Who We Are Looking For


Experience: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in customer experience or support contexts.
SQL Expertise: Proficient in SQL (Redshift, Oracle, or similar databases).
Customer Metrics Knowledge: Strong understanding of Customer Experience metrics (CSAT, NPS, CES, etc.).
Data Visualization Skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Quicksight.
Autonomous Analyst: Ability to manage end-to-end data processes with minimal supervision.
ETL & Data Modeling: Experience with data modeling and building ETL pipelines.
Python for Data: Python scripting experience for data manipulation is a plus.
Statistical Tools: Familiarity with R, SAS, or Matlab is valued.
Proactive & Solution-Oriented: Strong problem-solving mindset with the ability to turn complex data into clear insights.



What We Offer


Pet-friendly environment, where you can bring your furry desk buddy;
Discounts on our top-notch products;
Health insurance including dentist;
24 days holidays / year +1 day/year at Emma (máx. 29 days);
The opportunity to collaborate with multinational teams;
Exciting events that aren't just team-building exercises but opportunities to create epic memories;
All the tools you need to grow and ownership from the beginning.



Become an Emmie

Emma is transforming the world of sleep - and we want the highest-performing people to help us pull it off. We want you. But only if you're willing to go all in. Only if you're willing to question, disrupt, innovate, and create from the ground up.

We proudly celebrate diversity. We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting inclusion in our workplace. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, ethnic origin, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.

Our aim is to get back to you in a couple of days, however, we are currently receiving a large number of applications and this might lead to a delay in the process. We will get back to you as soon as possible!

Title: Data Analyst - Support Strategy
Description:
About Us

Indie Campers, the go-to campervan Marketplace, is on a mission of making road trips available to everyone. Thanks to its digital approach and customer-centric orientation, Indie Campers has developed a strong booking experience and high-quality road trips at affordable prices.

With over one million nights rented through our travel platform, we have welcomed more than 300,000 travelers from 169 countries. We offer a comprehensive and expanding array of road trip possibilities: short-term RV rentals, long-term campervan subscriptions, and the possibility of buying one of our vehicles available for sale.

Rooted in a deep technological focus, our challenges are both exciting and demanding and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and joining an ever-developing journey.

THE ROLE

As the Data Analyst for the Support Strategy team at Indie Campers, you will be responsible for managing the availability and accuracy of data related to our Support team’s operations. Your primary focus will be on automating processes and enhancing our data infrastructure. You´ll drive efficiency and performance improvements in customer support together with collaborating closely with the Support Strategy team to develop impactful dashboards and reports that facilitate data-driven decision-making.

Your analytical mindset and attention to detail will empower the Support team to leverage reliable data to enhance quality, efficiency, and customer service standards.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?


Collaborate with the Global Support team to understand their data needs and provide analytical support to improve operations and decision-making.
Contribute to a data-driven culture by enhancing data marts, implementing data quality standards, and developing actionable KPI dashboards specific to customer support.
Collect, organise, and analyse support-related data to produce insightful reports.
Execute ETL processes across all relevant databases to ensure seamless data flow within the Support team.
Proactively propose initiatives to enhance data analytics capabilities and improve overall business performance related to customer support.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Business, Economics, or a related field.
Up to 3 years of professional experience in similar roles.
Experience with data availability and accuracy, automation of processes, and familiarity with SQL and database management.
Experience building dashboards with Metabase and/or Tableau.
Experience with tools such as Airtable and Zendesk would be a plus.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritise tasks and maintain organisation.
Adaptable and flexible in a dynamic work environment.
Fluency in English is mandatory.


Are you ready to Go Indie?

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
About DataCamp

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

About the role

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

About you

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets—you aim to understand the "why" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities


Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.
Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.


Qualifications


Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.


Why Datacamp?

Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:


Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences & training to support your professional growth.
Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team—seriously, we're awesome!


Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!
Show more

Title: Data Visualization (Looker)
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We seek a Data Visualization willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa/ Carnaxide - must live in Portugal - mandatory).

Are you the one?


2/3+ years of experience in Data roles (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, etc.);
Advanced knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and transformation;
Experience with Power BI and/or Looker (LookML);
Solid understanding of ETL, data pipelines, cleaning, and modeling;
English proficiency at B1 level or higher (comfortable with technical reading and basic communication).


We Believe We Are The Ones To, By


Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.


Oh… And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to joana.ferreira@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.
Show more

Title: Global Insights Senior Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) will be home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP will offer rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Commercial Analytics Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

The Global Commercial Insights team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Global Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving global commercial strategy. As a Global Insights Senior Associate, you will support development of global analytical tools and capabilities that enable Global Insights teams to leverage secondary data to derive insights and help accelerate business decisions to support products and pipeline assets across therapy areas. Additionally, you will assist in landscape research across therapy areas and disease states to support global commercial deliverables including brand planning, opportunity assessments, global performance tracking, etc.

The individual in this role must be willing to solve ambiguous problems by leveraging both technical and consultative skills sets

Responsibilities will include:


Design, implement, and optimize global analytical tools and frameworks that enable Global Insights teams to extract insights from secondary data, supporting data-driven decision-making.
Build secondary data analytics toolbox to train and guide the Global Insights teams to efficiently use secondary data for insights generation for several global commercial deliverables.
Build ETL processes (Extract, Transform, & Load) for several data sources, analyze patterns and trends, and develop data models to support business needs.
Design systems for data storage, processing, and integration while ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Design, build, and maintain interactive Tableau/Power BI reports & dashboards with AI-driven analytics, troubleshoot issues, and optimize performance.
Ensure clear documentation for reports, dashboards, caveats, and processes for long-term usability.
Explore new data sources, methodologies, and visualization techniques (including AI-based techniques and methodologies) to enhance insights generation and increase the impact of secondary analytics in decision-making influencing global commercial strategy across portfolio.
Utilize syndicated and real-world data sources (e.g., IQVIA, claims data, epidemiology data) to generate dashboards for key metrics across diseases.
Conduct landscape assessments across multiple therapy areas and disease states, identifying key market trends and unmet needs to support global commercial deliverables.
Set priorities, develop and manage multiple projects and timelines simultaneously.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Minimum 3 years of experience in Pharma/Biotech analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Master’s degree and 3 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
University Degree in data science, commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint knowledge


Preferred Requirements:


Familiarity with technologies and applications, and hands-on experience to analyze, synthesize, and integrate various secondary data
Knowledge in data, analytics, research, and/or dashboarding & reporting approach
Experience with commonly used biopharmaceutical industry secondary datasets and databases
A keen eye for design, with the ability to develop compelling Power BI and Tableau dashboards
Ability to write and execute SQL queries to extract and manipulate data
Skilled in tools like Tableau, Python, and PowerBI
Knowledge of AI and ability to integrate AI-based solutions in workflow / dashboard / tools / analytics
Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and draw meaningful conclusions
Ability to identify and resolve technical issues
Knowledge of modern cloud-based warehouse technologies such as Snowflake, Amazon Redshift is preferred
Ability to drive implementation to enhance methodologies and standard processes in secondary data analytics
Strong oral and written presentation skills, with ability to explain complex concepts verbally or visually via PowerPoint / Excel
Evident project management skills—able to manage multiple, simultaneous projects and data sources
Understanding of the Bio-Pharmaceutical and biotech industry trends and operations
Ability to work collaboratively in team-based environment


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Show more

THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us

  • Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
  • Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
  • Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
  • Flexible work arrangements.

APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Turkish Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


Job Information

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.

We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

  • Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language

Job Information

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.

We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Fraud Reporting Data Analyst
Description:
Na AXIANS procuramos o talento certo, para o lugar certo. Trabalhamos diariamente para envolver as nossas pessoas num ambiente colaborativo e inclusivo, com uma cultura de proximidade. Faz também parte da nossa cultura a preocupação com o meio ambiente e a realização de ações de responsabilidade corporativa social e ambiental.

Esta pode ser a sua oportunidade de integrar um projeto de âmbito internacional, com um cliente que precisa de si para responder aos desafios da transformação digital.

💻 O CARGO

Procuramos um #TechTalent para desempenhar funções enquanto Fraud Reporting Data Analyst para um projeto na área financeira.

💡 O QUE PROCURAMOS


Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, Estatística, Matemática Aplicada, Gestão, Economia ou similar
Experiência prévia em funções analíticas
Excelente capacidade de análise e resolução de problemas
Experiência no desenvolvimento com ferramentas de visualização, valorizamos MS PowerBI
Proficiência em SQL e DAX
Experiência no desenho e implementação de processos ETL
Experiência com Databricks é valorizada
Conhecimentos de algoritmos de Machine Learning (e.g. Random Forest, XGBoost, LGBM) e tecnologias Big Data como (Spark, Hadoop) são valorizados
Experiência em deteção de fraude será valorizada


⭐O QUE PODE ESPERAR DE NÓS

Carreira profissional estável

Ao trabalhar com projetos da Axians torna-se uma mais valia a quem queremos oferecer estabilidade, através de uma carreira segura.

Perspetivas de progressão na carreira

Poderá aceder a formações e novas certificações que elevarão ainda mais as suas competências. A avaliação 360° dos managers e peers também permitirão evoluir.

Conciliação entre a área profissional e a familiar

Colaborando com a Axians há abertura para conciliar as exigências laborais com os requisitos familiares, evitando negligenciar cada uma das áreas.

Compensação evolutiva e atrativa

Ao trabalhar com clientes da Axians, terá acesso a prémios de performance, além de um pack salarial atrativo (vencimento base + benefícios). Também tem direito a seguro de saúde e consultas de psicologia gratuitas.

Title: Data Documentalist / Data Governance
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Support the build-up of Data Catalog, enhancing the completeness and accuracy of Data Dictionary, Business Glossary, Data Lineage, Data Classification and Governance.


Essential Skills


At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
Experience of reading technical documentation for systems;
Experience of creating data dictionaries, business glossaries and data governance models;
Good knowledge of Python and SQL;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply


The candidate must be resident in Portugal.
