Title: Analytic Consultant
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currently searching for a Consultant for the Revenue Growth Management team.

You will work together with some of the largest FMCG companies, helping them to make the right choices for their price and promo strategy, considering the impact on sales and P&L.

You will manage the Price and Promo projects, working together with the executive teams, analyzing the outputs of the projects, and providing insightful price and promo recommendations.

Your insights will influence decisions for some of today’s leading global companies.

Responsibilities


To be part of an international project team that helps FMCG clients optimizing their pricing and promotion activities
Use NielsenIQ tools and methodologies to build answers to business questions based on the market data and revenue management analysis
To convert analytical results into a business-focused and actionable client report
To deliver insights and recommendations to the client during formal or informal meetings
Coordinate project execution between experts’ teams


a Little Bit About You

Curiosity drives your interest in what impacts the market. Managing time, deadlines and different projects comes naturally to you. You enjoy working with a good team spirit and you’re known for your organization and good communication. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data to search for new angles. You can identify business potential and build a narrative behind numbers, and you are always looking for what’s next.

Qualifications


2 - 3 years of experience in a similar position/ business area
Previous experience in FMCG sector, preferably trade marketing, consumer insights, key account/category management, in which price, promo and revenue management figures are familiar variables
High level of business relationship skills
Strong analytical mindset and excellent numerical skills
Strong communication & visualization skills – interested in storytelling techniques
Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment
Experience working with PowerBI would be an asset
Ability to work independently
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint;
Strong organizational & interpersonal skills;
University degree or equivalent experience;


What we can offer:


Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
Access to learning platforms
Staff and team events


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


#Hybrid

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Fraud Reporting Data Analyst (Power BI)
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
  • Previous experience in analytical roles with a strong ability to interpret data;
  • Hands-on experience developing reports and dashboards with Power BI and other Microsoft tools;
  • Proficiency in SQL and DAX;
  • Solid experience in designing, developing, and maintaining ETL processes;
  • Fluent in English.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Remote;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at lpaulo@aubay.pt.


Os dados pessoais recolhidos pela AUBAY PORTUGAL SA relativos à identificação, contacto e habilitação dos candidatos, enquanto responsável pelo tratamento e do co-responsável de tratamento usado no âmbito do presente procedimento, serão utilizados para efeitos de Candidatura para integração na equipa, considerando que os mesmos se destinam à execução de diligências pré-contratuais a pedido do titular dos dados;

Os dados remetidos através da presente aplicação, detido pela AUBAY serão mantidos durante o processo de recrutamento em curso, e serão guardados para as finalidades indicadas, enquanto considerados atualizados (um ano).

Os dados recolhidos poderão ser transmitidos ou incluir outras atividades de tratamento, mediante informação do respetivo titular, na decorrência normal de um processo de recrutamento e seleção, podendo igualmente vir a ser conservados para o cumprimento de quaisquer obrigações legais, pelo prazo previsto na legislação aplicável.

Para o exercício de qualquer direito relativo à proteção de dados pessoais, pode contactar a AUBAY PORTUGAL, com sede na Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa ou o Encarregado de Proteção de Dados através do seu e-mail dpo@aubay.pt, podendo ainda exercer os seus direitos junto da Autoridade Nacional de Proteção de Dados competente – www.cnpd.pt.

(*Não incluir dados relativos a origem racial ou étnica, opiniões políticas, convicções religiosas ou filosóficas, filiação sindical, dados genéticos, dados biométricos, dados relativos à saúde, dados relativos à vida sexual ou orientação sexual ou relacionados com condenações penais e infracções)

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A PrimeIT é uma empresa de referência, focada na prestação de serviços tecnológicos de IT, Telecomunicações e Engenharia. Potenciamos o negócio dos nossos parceiros, recorrendo à tecnologia mais avançada e aos melhores profissionais do sector. Somos especializados em Team Extension, Nearshore, Managed Services e Custom Software. Para isso, contamos atualmente com uma equipa de mais de 2300 profissionais que colaboram em projetos nacionais e internacionais nas mais diversas tecnologias.


📢 Procuramos um Data Analyst.

💻 Regime: Híbrido (em Lisboa).


🔎 O que procuramos?

✅Pelo menos 3 anos de experiência na área de dados;

✅Domínio de SQL;

✅Experiência prática com Python, utilizando bibliotecas como Pandas e NumPy para manipulação e análise de dados;

✅Sólida experiência com SQL Server;

✅Familiaridade com processos de ETL, nomeadamente através da ferramenta SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services);

✅Experiência na criação de dashboards e relatórios interativos com Power BI;

✅Fortes conhecimentos em SSRS.


👉🏼 O que oferecemos?

✅Integração numa empresa de dimensão internacional que cresce diariamente;

✅Formação constante nas mais recentes e inovadoras tecnologias - Prime Academy;

✅Acompanhamento e progressão de carreira.


📩 Envia o teu CV para ccsantos@primeit.pt e junta-te à equipa PrimeIT!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mission

Job Description

Quantitative Data Intelligence (QDI) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.

The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.

Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.

We seek to shape the technologies available to the client’s needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.

Main Tasks


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder’s’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder’s’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis


Perfil

Technical Skills


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus


Language Skills


Fluency in English


Soft Skills


Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure
Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team


Organização

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Número da Solicitação de Emprego: 88937

Horário: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Data analysis – understand and document the usage of data in the values of the received data formats.
Technical analysis of different data formats received from different data sources.
Use documentation and examples related to data interfaces to understand data structure and provide translation specifications (mappings) from one data format to another.
Identify and document gaps between producing and consuming applications and the Enterprise Data Models based on translation specifications (mappings)
Development and maintenance of documentation
Technical and non-technical stakeholder management (incl. information architects, business change managers, data product owners, data engineers, product owners and tech leads)
Ensure version control and governance around workflow management is followed.
Continuously seek and suggest improvements/optimisations to the process



Our requirements:



Bachelor’s degree in a relevant subject
At least 3 years’ experience working in similar role.
Knowledge of TMS systems and data attribute analysis and mapping is advantages
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
Being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to talk and present to a range of audiences, facilitating interactions to gain insight into open questions
The ability to work under pressure delivering on agreed deadlines
A good understanding of information technology
Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We seek a Business Intelligence Consultant willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa - must live in Portugal - mandatory).




Are you the one?




Design data schemas, modeling data structures and perform data migrations.
Design high-performance data pipelines & ETL processes.
Business Intelligence Professional – Key Qualifications.
Minimum of 3 years of experience with SQL.
Hands-on experience with SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services).
Proficient in Power BI (DAX) for data visualization and reporting.
Preferred knowledge of Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, and Python.
Strong interest and enthusiasm for consultancy work.




We believe we are the ones to, by:

Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.




Oh… and by the way, we also have:

Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to joana.ferreira@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

Title: Data Analyst (Internship)
Description:
About greenmetrics.ai




greenmetrics.ai is a Lisbon-based startup at the forefront of climate adaptation and environmental sustainability. We develop cutting-edge technological solutions using smart sensors, IoT connectivity and data analytics to collect and process environmental data, enabling our users to improve resilience against extreme weather events like floods, droughts and biodiversity loss.




We envision a future in which technology and human ingenuity are allies of the natural world, a future where data guides us on the path to a more sustainable, balanced and resilient way of living, preserving the delicate balance of our planet for future generations.




We are a bootstrapped, independent, profitable startup, with proven technology and systems operating in +15 cities in Portugal. We are starting our international expansion to Europe, Brazil and Latin America and we need your contribution to help us accelerate towards our goals.




The Role




As a Data Analyst Intern, you’ll work closely with our analytics and strategic teams, collecting and examining environmental data, applying Python-based tools to uncover trends, and crafting compelling visualizations that drive effective climate adaptation strategies. You'll enjoy the freedom to propose creative data analytics approaches and generate actionable insights that help shape climate policies and develop state-of-the-art risk assessment tools.

Whether you’re developing data-driven solutions to tackle climate challenges, scaling our current analytics capabilities, or pioneering fresh visualization strategies, your work will deepen our understanding of climate change and enhance our ability to navigate an increasingly uncertain world. Join us, and be a catalyst for change as we empower communities to make informed, impactful decisions for a sustainable future.




You will be responsible for:




Implementing innovative data analytics frameworks that account for future climate scenarios to conduct climate vulnerability analyses and improve adaptation efforts.
Collecting data from environmental datasets to perform climate resilience assessments.
Performing comprehensive analyses to identify patterns, trends and correlations using statistical methods and Python libraries and tools.
Creating visualizations to communicate assessment results and conclusions effectively.
Participating in strategic projects that influence the definition of adaptation actions.
Documenting findings and conclusions through structured reports.
Supporting the development of data visualization platforms and tools.




Your profile:




A strong background in Data Analytics, Data Engineering or any related field that provides a solid foundation for the role's responsibilities.
Proven practical experience working with data analytics or data engineering in previous positions or personal projects.
Proficiency with Python libraries and tools (e.g. Jupyter notebooks, NumPy, Plotly, Pandas) to explore, transform and load datasets and develop analyses.
A proactive and resourceful attitude to engage with stakeholders in obtaining new datasets.
Comfort in obtaining data from API sources and working with Git for version control.
Excellent capacity to communicate complex data insights verbally and in writing in Portuguese and English.
Experience using GIS or GeoPandas for geospatial data analysis is a plus.




Learning Outcomes:




Gain hands-on experience in developing and applying data analytics frameworks within the climate tech sector.
Enhance your ability to perform detailed data analyses and create visualizations that effectively communicate complex insights.
Develop a strong understanding of climate vulnerability assessments and resilience strategies through real-world projects.
Build proficiency in using advanced Python libraries and tools for data analysis and visualization.
Strengthen your collaborative skills by working alongside experts in data science and climate research on impactful projects.




Position Details:




Workload: Full-time Paid Internship

Duration: 6 months

Preferred Model: Hybrid (Based in Portugal)

Application Start: 06/apr

Application Deadline: 27/apr

Planned Start Date: 01/may




Application Process:




No need to prepare a cover letter for this application but we will need a couple of things from you:

Linkedin profile
Updated CV
Answers to 5 application questions

﻿

We know you are busy and we respect your time, so we prepared a short application form with the purpose of knowing you better, understanding your skills, strengths and interests so we can guarantee that we’re a match!




We want to make sure that you will feel motivated and excited about taking part on this journey. So we ask you to answer confidently and consider that there are no right or wrong answers to these questions.




This application form should take you less than 30 minutes to complete.

Title: Internal Auditor - Data Analyst New Joiners
Description:
The Risk Assurance Services area of PwC is dedicated to the analysis and management of business risks, helping organizations strengthen their governance, optimize processes, and comply with regulations. Its objective is to provide security and confidence to stakeholders through audits, evaluation of internal controls, and the use of technology to minimize risks.

In this team, you will deal with complex business challenges and outline strategies for our clients in Portugal and internationally, using technology and data analysis to increase security and optimize the efficiency of companies' processes.

Integrated into the Risk Assurance team, the professional to be hired will have the following main responsibilities:


Conduct internal audits and risk assessments for clients from different sectors
Analyze and optimize processes, ensuring compliance with regulations and best practices
Support the implementation and improvement of internal control systems and corporate governance
Work with data analysis and technology tools to enhance the effectiveness of audit processes
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop customized solutions for clients


Curious?

Can you already imagine being part of our Community?

Requirements

If you are convinced that this opportunity is for you, then you just need to make sure you meet the following requirements - take a look:


Bachelor's and/or master's degree in Management, Economics, Finance, or similar areas
Interest in Internal Audit, Internal Control, Data Analysis, and process optimization
Analytical skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking
Dynamism and strong team spirit
Capacity for learning
Responsible and resilient
Fluency in Portuguese (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of English (spoken and written)


If, like us, you believe that the success of PwC lies in the essence of People and their authenticity, dynamism, and willingness to go "beyond," then… you have found your "world".

It's time to apply - we want you to be part of the "Team PwC"!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day


As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Ensure high quality of delivery
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Create/Update some dashboards
Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team based in Lisbon and Porto. Our working language is English, and we offer a hybrid work model
You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has three mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges
The team is young, agile, and everyone is growing together. More than 20 colleagues are working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences, and you will be able to share your insights with the central teams in Paris
We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?

Do you have…


A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field?
At least 3 years of relevant experience
Strong programming skills in Python?
Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
Fluency in oral and written English.
Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau Software)
Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
Availability for occasional travel in Europe


If you bring all this, a lot of desire, energy and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for...

We look forward to receiving your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more
HTML:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day

  • As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
    • Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
    • Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
    • Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
    • Ensure high quality of delivery
    • Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
    • Create/Update some dashboards
    • Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
    • Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!

  • Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team based in Lisbon and Porto. Our working language is English, and we offer a hybrid work model
  • You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has three mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges
  • The team is young, agile, and everyone is growing together. More than 20 colleagues are working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences, and you will be able to share your insights with the central teams in Paris
  • We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities

What do we have to offer you?

  • This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.

Are you the one we are looking for?

Do you have…

  • A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field?
  • At least 3 years of relevant experience
  • Strong programming skills in Python?
  • Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
  • Fluency in oral and written English.
  • Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
  • Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau Software)
  • Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
  • Availability for occasional travel in Europe

If you bring all this, a lot of desire, energy and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for...

We look forward to receiving your application!

Our commitments

  • BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
  • To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization

What makes us proud as reference employer?

  • Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
  • 92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
  • 93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
  • 71% of our customers are promoters of our brand

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Semasio, a Samba TV company, is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands trust our industry-leading advertising solutions to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. Our team is located globally in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany, and Denmark.

We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community. Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks your curiosity, then read on!

Are you passionate about turning data into insights? Do you have a keen eye for detail and a drive to optimize business performance? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for a Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team in

Porto. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and efficiency of our data models and reports. Your contributions will directly impact strategic decision-making, providing stakeholders with critical insights to drive the company forward.




What You’ll Do:
Maintain and update our BI data model, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Own specific monthly reports and updates, ensuring timely and precise delivery.
Work closely with different teams to understand reporting needs and enhance data quality.
Identify opportunities to improve data structures and reporting processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data inconsistencies or anomalies.
Support the development of new dashboards and analytics solutions.




What We’re Looking For:
Strong attention to detail—nothing slips past you!
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for optimizing data processes.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Basic understanding of data modeling concepts and database structures.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive attitude, always looking for ways to improve and streamline reporting.
A degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus.




Why Join Us?
Be part of a data-driven company that values innovation and continuous learning.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions matter.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the exciting field of Business Intelligence.







Samba TV is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.

Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, under the applicable law. For further details, please see Samba's Applicant Privacy Policy. For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Junior (1-3 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying, data extraction, and manipulation.
Familiarity with ETL processes (experience with Stambia is a plus).
Ability to work with large datasets and optimize data workflows.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in French and English (both written and spoken).
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Proficiency in Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Knowledge of data governance and data management best practices.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Candidates With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent;
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience mining data as a Data Analyst;
  • Good analytics skills, including mining, modelling logical and conceptual, evaluation and data visualization;
  • Strong Power BI, SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools;
  • Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;
  • Customer oriented;
  • Fluency in English will be valued.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated against on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

• Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

• Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

• Power BI Experience;

• Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

• Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

• Fluent English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.

Your Mission Will Be


Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need


Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
Fluency in Portuguese and English;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have


BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience working with SQL Server.


With Us You Can Be a


TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!
Show more
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.

Your Mission Will Be

  • Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
  • Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.

You Will Need

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
  • Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
  • Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English;
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.

Would Be Awesome If You Have

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
  • Experience working with SQL Server.

With Us You Can Be a

  • TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
  • TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
  • InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
  • InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!

Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project in Porto (twice a week in the office).




Requirements:

• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area

• Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime, etc

• Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI

• Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions

• Good knowledge about SQL




Other Requirements:

• Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive

• Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku

• A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others

• Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required

• Fluent in English (both written and verbal) (mandatory)

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a data-driven professional to create dashboards and KPIs for a client in the automotive industry. If you have strong Power BI skills, a sharp analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, we’d love to hear from you!




What will you do?

The data analyst consultant will be responsible for:

Collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data sets.
Conducting statistical analyses.
Collaborating with business teams to identify needs and propose suitable automation solutions.
Ensuring data visualization through BI tools such as Power BI.
Participating in the implementation of best data management practices within the department.




Who are you?

Proven experience as a data analyst in the banking sector, ideally in CIB.
Proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and programming languages (e.g., Python).
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation, as well as other languages like DAX, M.
Knowledge of statistical models and predictive modeling techniques.
Excellent communication skills to interact with multidisciplinary teams: Business, IT, etc.
Experience in IT-driven project management.
Ability to formalize complex topics.
Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.




Apply today or send your CV directly for joel.leite@migso-pcubed.com

You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Customer Data Analyst.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Analyze Customer Data: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources (e.g., CRM systems, web analytics, social media) using tools like SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks to identify trends, behaviors, and insights that drive engagement strategies.
Develop Audience Segmentation: Create and manage detailed audience segments based on customer data, using platforms such as Relay42 to tailor marketing strategies and campaigns to specific customer groups.
Support Marketing Automation: Develop and manage data-driven marketing automation strategies, including segmentation, lead scoring, and personalized campaigns, to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates.
Create and Maintain Dashboards: Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights into customer engagement metrics, campaign performance, and overall marketing effectiveness, utilizing visualization tools and data platforms.


Monitor and Optimize Campaign Performance: Track and analyze the performance of marketing automation campaigns, including those run through Relay42, providing insights and recommendations for optimization based on data analysis using SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks.

What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Expertise in Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as SAS, Alteryx, Databricks, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI to analyze and present data.
Experience with Marketing Automation Platforms: Knowledge of marketing automation tools such as Relay42, HubSpot, Marketo, or Salesforce Marketing Cloud, including experience with setting up and managing automated workflows and campaigns.
Audience Creation and Management: Experience in creating and managing audience segments, leveraging data-driven insights to inform targeted marketing strategies and improve engagement.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights that drive customer engagement and marketing effectiveness.


Communication and Reporting: Excellent skills in creating clear, concise reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

Title: Data Analyst - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Data Analyst to join our team. Your role will be to work across multiple systems to locate, organize, and correlate unstructured data, ensuring it is maintained and presented accurately.

As a Data Analyst, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include

Strategy (non-exhaustive)


Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple systems across 10 countries in the Multilingual Region.
Ensure data consistency and correlation across various dimensions such as but not limited to headcount, languages, verticals, channels, and various other KPIs and benchmarks.
Maintain a structured repository of accurate and up-to-date data for regular access and reporting.
Compare and contrast data from different setups (e.g., B&M vs. WFH) to provide insights into strategy.
Benchmark against industry standards and highlight areas of differentiation.
Analyze pipeline trends and detect discrepancies (e.g., Salesforce data vs. ongoing opportunities).
Perform Lost/Win analyses, deal duration assessments, and revenue impact evaluations.
Provide forecasts and recalculations to reflect pipeline variations and trends accurately.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling insights and narratives that support client proposals and internal strategies.
Create visualizations and summaries that drive understanding and action among diverse stakeholders.
Liaise with stakeholders across Sales, Solutions, Operations, and other support teams to collect and validate data.
Partner with team members to provide tailored insights and analytics for specific projects or opportunities.
Work closely with the sales and solutions team to ensure that the latest analytics methodologies, case studies, and thinking are being featured in new proposals.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Work closely with internal teams (Reporting, CI, Operations, etc.) to uncover insights and trends.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership on the progress and performance of our analytics initiatives and their impact on the business.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have : ‎


Native or proficient level of English (C2) - mandatory
Additional languages are valued
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel - mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Strong analytical and storytelling skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from data.
Exceptional organizational skills to manage diverse datasets and ensure consistency.
Ability to work proactively and independently across multiple systems to locate and understand data.
Strong cross-collaboration skills to work effectively with various teams and stakeholders.
Advanced Excel: pivot tables, complex formulas, macros, etc.- mandatory
Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce for pipeline analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau).
Familiarity with cloud-based collaboration tools (e.g., SharePoint; SharePoint Lists, etc.)
Knowledge of database query languages (e.g., SQL) is a plus.
Exposure to ETL tools/processes is desirable (advanced Excel or scripts like Python or R to mimic ETL processes is a plus).
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work in our Porto Site


Education And Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a sales, operations, or BPO environment.
Experience working with unstructured and multidimensional data sets across different systems
Familiarity with pipeline dynamics and CRM systems (Salesforce experience highly valued).


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever™

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career. 

Apply today!
Show more

Title: Data analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) for ETL development.
Strong experience with SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services) for data modeling.
Hands-on expertise in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) for report generation.
Solid experience with SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Experience in working with large datasets and optimizing queries for performance.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken).
Experience with Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
Knowledge of data governance and best practices in data management.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
    • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
    • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
    • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!

  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.
